0.title: When sh**ty things happen, we tend to take irrational decisions: FTX ex-CEO
0.article_body: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sent an apology letter to the employees of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange. He wrote, "I feel deeply sorry about what happened…I froze up in the face of pressure and leaks and the Binance LOI and said nothing...Nothing that happened was your fault….When sh**ty things happen to us, we all tend to make irrational decisions."

1.title: I've my eye on Shraddha murder case, killer will get strictest punishment: Amit Shah
1.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that Delhi Police will ensure that Shraddha Walkar's killer will get the strictest punishment at the earliest, adding, "I've my eye on the matter." "Shraddha had sent a letter to Maharashtra Police saying that she would be killed and cut into pieces. Even after that, no action was taken," he added.

2.title: Pope compares war in Ukraine to 1930s famine caused by Stalin
2.article_body: Pope Francis compared Russian war in Ukraine to the "terrible genocide" of the 1930s, saying that "the extermination by famine was...caused by Stalin". During his address at St Peter's Square in Vatican City, Pope Francis mentioned "Holodomor", or death by starvation and said that Ukrainians were suffering today from "martyrdom of aggression". "Let's pray for victims of...genocide," he added.

3.title: 'Rats ate 580 kg of weed', says UP's Mathura Police; court demands proof
3.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Mathura Police submitted a report to a special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act (1985) court, claiming that rats "ate" over 580 kg of confiscated weed stored in warehouses. Following the police report, the court asked the police to get rid of the "mice menace" and deliver proof that the rats actually ate the weed worth ₹60 lakh.

4.title: Uber, 2 delivery apps propose offering Mexico drivers social security
4.article_body: Uber and delivery apps DiDi and Rappi on Wednesday said they're open to offering Mexico drivers and couriers social security benefits. According to their statement, those who work an average of over 40 hours a week on one or more platforms can be eligible for the benefits. This comes ahead of a bill in Mexico that will regulate gig economy.

5.title: Muslim students beaten in Guj over 'love jihad' allegations, video surfaces
5.article_body: A group of men, reportedly belonging to Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), assaulted three Muslim college students in Gujarat on Wednesday over 'love jihad' allegations. A two-minute video of the incident has gone viral on the internet, showing a group of men wearing handkerchiefs as masks as they assault the three students.

6.title: Nations far away from US may see improvement in Twitter's speed: Musk
6.article_body: Days after saying that Twitter is "very slow" in India and many other countries, CEO Elon Musk said on Thursday there could be improvements to Twitter's speed. "You might notice small...major improvements in speed of Twitter...Will be especially significant in countries far away from USA," posted Musk. "Sometimes, it doesn't work at all, especially on Android phones," he had said.

7.title: Traffic movement to remain affected on Delhi's Ring Road for nearly 11 months
7.article_body: Traffic movement on Delhi's Ring Road in both the carriageways from Rajouri Garden towards Punjabi Bagh and vice-versa will remain affected for nearly 11 months, the Delhi Traffic Police said in an advisory. The traffic will remain hit due to the construction of an elevated road from New Moti Nagar flyover to ESI Hospital, the police informed on Thursday.

8.title: Amazon to shut down its online learning platform in India from Aug 2023
8.article_body: Amazon will be shutting down its online learning vertical, Amazon Academy, in India starting August 2023. The company said it will refund the full fee to those enrolled in the current batch and customers will have access to course material until October 2024. While Amazon didn't specify a reason, a report said this is a part of Amazon's cost-cutting measures.

9.title: TMC writes to poll body over 'foreigners' campaigning for BJP in Gujarat
9.article_body: TMC National Spokesperson Saket Gokhale wrote to ECI demanding urgent action in connection with alleged involvement of "foreigners" in election campaigning for BJP in Gujarat. This came after BJP Gujarat tweeted a video. "Foreigners being used by BJP...in complete violation of election laws. Also, foreigners sound Russian, raising serious questions of interference in elections," Gokhale tweeted.

10.title: Inadequate: HC on compensation to Morbi tragedy victims' families
10.article_body: Gujarat High Court has criticised the state government over the compensation given to families of the people who died in the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy, calling it "inadequate and unrealistic". "The compensation paid to critically injured is also not enough," it added. Moreover, the court ordered the Gujarat government to conduct a survey of all bridges in the state.

11.title: Give extra measles vaccine dose to kids in vulnerable areas: Centre
11.article_body: The Centre has asked states and Union Territories to administer an additional dose of measles and rubella vaccines to children aged nine months to five years in vulnerable areas. This comes amid a rise in measles cases in some states, including Maharashtra and Bihar. The states have been asked to earmark wards and beds for effective management of measles cases.

12.title: Paytm's 75% stock decline is world's worst in 10 years among large IPOs
12.article_body: Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications has seen its shares decline 75% from its listing price. Since 2012, this drop is the steepest first-year slide globally among IPOs that raised at least the same amount, as per Bloomberg. On November 23, Paytm shares hit an all-time low of ₹440, falling below the previous low of ₹511 on May 12.

13.title: B'luru man, who turned woman, to get gender-corrected passport: Report
13.article_body: The Regional Passport Office (RPO) in Bengaluru received a gender change request on a passport after a resident underwent sex-change surgery to become a woman. This is reportedly the first time that a passport is being rectified for gender change after a surgical procedure since the process became digitised. The woman's new passport will be issued after police verification.

14.title: Unknown Islamist group claims responsibility for Mangaluru blast, probe begins
14.article_body: The police have launched an investigation after an unknown Islamist group, Islamic Resistance Council, claimed responsibility for the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast in a statement, reports said. According to the group's statement, the target was a temple in Kadri but the bomb exploded before reaching there. The group also threatened Karnataka ADGP (Law and Order) Alok Kumar in the statement.

15.title: We held on due to lessons learnt by our players in Germany: Japan coach
15.article_body: Reacting to 24th-ranked Japan defeating four-time champions Germany 2-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Japan's manager Hajime Moriyasu said, "[In] the end, they came at us with...full power." "In the past, maybe we would have lost, but the players have been playing in Germany...They have learned so much from that, so we held on," added Moriyasu.

16.title: Game of Thrones actor Wilko Johnson passes away aged 75
16.article_body: Wilko Johnson, who portrayed mute executioner Ilyn Payne in Game of Thrones, has passed away at the age of 75. A guitarist for 1970s pub-rock band Dr Feelgood, Johnson passed away at home on Monday. Johnson, who was born in Canvey Island, Essex, was diagnosed with late stage pancreatic cancer in early 2013.

17.title: Vladimir Putin can no longer win war in Ukraine: German Chancellor
17.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "can no longer win on the battlefield". During a joint press conference in Berlin, Scholz called for an immediate end to Russia's "bombing terror against the civilian population". "My appeal to Putin remains: stop senseless killing, withdraw your troops completely from Ukraine and agree to peace talks," Scholz added.

18.title: Glenmark Pharma's Goa unit receives US regulator's warning letter
18.article_body: The United States Food & Drug Administration (USFDA) has issued a warning letter to Glenmark Pharmaceuticals' manufacturing facility in Goa. USFDA inspected the Goa facility in May 2022 and issued Official Action Indicated. The drug maker believes that the warning letter will not have an impact on the "disruption of supplies or the existing revenue from operations of this facility".

19.title: Govt to bring law to regulate digital media: Union Minister Anurag Thakur
19.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur has said that the Centre is working on a bill to regulate digital media. He said communication of news has become multidimensional with the development of electronic and digital media. "It presents opportunities as well as challenges. To have a fine balance, the government will see what can be done on this," he said.

20.title: Brazilian court rejects Bolsonaro's election challenge, imposes $4.27 mn fine
20.article_body: A court in Brazil has rejected outgoing President Jair Bolsonaro's demand to annul votes cast on most of the nation's electronic voting machines, imposing a $4.27 million fine on his coalition for "bad faith" litigation. The court called Bolsonaro's request "bizarre" and "illicit", adding that the challenge appeared to be a ploy to encourage more anti-democratic protests in the country.

21.title: Auditioned for 'The Amazing Spider-Man', Andrew Garfield got it: Joe
21.article_body: Singer-actor Joe Jonas revealed that he had auditioned for 'The Amazing Spider-Man' but he didn't get it. He said he was "excited" about the part but when he didn't get it, in that moment, he felt "destroyed" and "defeated". The 2012 film featured Andrew Garfield in the lead role of Spider-Man. "Obviously, he was the right one," Joe said.

22.title: Pant is becoming a liability, bring in Sanju Samson: Reetinder Sodhi
22.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said Rishabh Pant is becoming a "liability" for India, adding that it's time to provide an opportunity to Sanju Samson. "You got to take that chance because you cannot afford to lose...in...ICC tournaments. When you give too many chances, problems arise," added Reetinder. "If he's not performing, you've...to show him the exit door," he stated.

23.title: Amazon plans to invest $1 bn a year to make movies for theatres: Report
23.article_body: Amazon is planning to invest more than $1 billion a year to make movies for theatres, Bloomberg reported. The company aims to produce between 12 and 15 films annually for theatrical release, the report added. The world's largest e-commerce firm will reportedly release a small number of movies in cinemas next year and increase its output over time.

24.title: We hear people's 'Mann Ki Baat' for 8 hrs unlike PM: Rahul Gandhi
24.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that his party listened to people's 'Mann Ki Baat' for eight hours during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and spoke for 15 minutes, unlike PM Narendra Modi's monthly radio programme in which he addresses nation for 30 minutes. "We listen to what is on the mind of farmers, youth, women, labourers and small-scale traders," he added.

25.title: Vizhinjam port may miss Dec 2023 deadline due to protests: Adani Group
25.article_body: Kerala government's ₹7,500-crore Vizhinjam Seaport, being developed by the Adani Group, is facing protests by the locals. Adani Group said if the protests continue, their December 2023 deadline might get extended. The protesters allege that the project will adversely affect the fishermen's livelihoods, the coastal ecosystem and the ecology of the Western Ghats due to the mining of granite stones.

26.title: Vijay fined ₹500 for flouting tinted glass norms: Report
26.article_body: Tamil actor Vijay has reportedly been fined ₹500 by the Chennai Traffic Police for flouting the tinted glass norms. As per a report, the actor was penalised for this violation after he met his fans at the fan club Vijay Makkal Iyakkam's office in Chennai on Monday. On the work front, Vijay will be seen in Vamshi Paidipally's 'Varisu'.

27.title: One who wants to serve country won't want to be Agniveer: Akhilesh
27.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that one who wants to serve the country will never want to become Agniveer. "The government is saying that it is saving the budget through these schemes, but when the country itself will not survive, how can the budget survive," Yadav added. He was addressing an ex-servicemen conference in poll-bound Mainpuri.

28.title: Why didn't police take any action?: DCW chief on Shraddha’s complaint in 2020
28.article_body: After a complaint surfaced which was filed by Shraddha Walkar in 2020 against Aftab Poonawala, who allegedly murdered her, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal asked, "Why no action was taken by the police?" "As long as the systems of the country will remain so hollow, girls will keep dying like this," she tweeted.

29.title: 2 MP men arrested for carrying marijuana worth ₹2 lakh in Pune
29.article_body: Two men from Madhya Pradesh have been arrested for allegedly carrying marijuana worth ₹2.06 lakh in Pune. Acting on a tip, the police recovered 10.31 kg of marijuana from the bags the suspects were carrying on their shoulders in Yerwada on Wednesday. They also seized cell phones of the suspects. A case under the NDPS Act has been registered.

30.title: Railways fired 1 'non-performer' every 3 days since July 2021: Officials
30.article_body: Indian Railways has fired one "non-performer or corrupt official" every three days since July 2021, officials said. They said while 139 officers were forced to take voluntary retirement, 38 others were removed from service. After Ashwini Vaishnaw took office as Railways Minister in July 2021, he warned officials "to take VRS and sit at home" if they did not perform.

31.title: Drinking water supply to be disrupted in parts of Hyderabad on Nov 26
31.article_body: Some parts of Hyderabad will face drinking water supply disruption on November 26 for 24 hours, starting from 6 am. The areas to be affected include Balapur, Lenin Nagar, Bandangpet, Budvel, Shamshabad and Almasguda. The disruption will be witnessed due to work that will be undertaken to address the water supply leakage at Shivaji Chowk and Balapur.

32.title: 2 IEDs recovered from suspected drone-dropped package in J&K
32.article_body: Two IEDs, a detonator, two Chinese pistols, ₹5 lakh cash, etc, have been recovered from a package that is suspected to have been dropped by a drone in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Thursday, according to the SSP. The items could have been used for "any untoward incident", the SSP said. Earlier, BSF had killed a Pakistani intruder in Jammu.

33.title: Richa Chadha apologises for insulting tweet on Indian Army, says 'I know how it feels'
33.article_body: Richa Chadha has deleted her insulting tweet on the Indian Army and apologised. She wrote, "A whole family is affected when their son is martyred or even injured...I personally know how it feels." She had tweeted, "Galwan says hi", while reacting to Northern Army Commander Lt General Upendra Dwivedi's statement that the Army is ready to take back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

34.title: He's critical, has multiple organ failure: Vikram Gokhale's wife
34.article_body: Actor Vikram Gokhale's wife Vrushali Gokhale has shared that the actor is "critical since the last 24 hours" and has "multiple organ failure". "Doctors are trying their best. He's not responding to the treatment as expected," she said. Earlier, his daughter Neha Gokhale said that the actor is "on life support" and asked his well-wishers to "keep praying for him".

35.title: Former ISI chief Lt General Syed Asim Munir appointed Pakistan's new army chief
35.article_body: Pakistan Federal Minister for Information & Broadcasting, Marriyum Aurangzeb, on Thursday announced that Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has appointed Lt General Syed Asim Munir as the country's new army chief. She also announced that Lt General Sahir Shamshad Mirza has been appointed as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Munir has served as Director-General of ISI in the past.

36.title: IT couple robbed at Parvati tekdi in Pune, 2 suspects arrested
36.article_body: A couple, working as IT professionals, were allegedly robbed of their gold chain, mobiles, wristwatch and cash at Parvati tekdi in Pune on Tuesday. The suspects stopped the couple and demanded valuables from them. When the victims refused, one of the suspects hit the man on his head with a sickle, injuring him. The police identified and arrested two suspects.

37.title: Video of 'Earth Rise' as seen from Moon goes viral
37.article_body: NASA has shared a video of "Earth Rise" as seen from the Moon. The footage was taken by Artemis 1 mission's unmanned Orion spacecraft. The Artemis 1, which was launched from Kennedy Space Center on November 16 after two failed attempts, is a critical part of NASA's Moon to Mars exploration approach.

38.title: SC questions the speed of CEC Arun Goel's appointment, govt asks SC to 'hold your mouth'
38.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday questioned the "lightning speed" at which Chief Election Commissioner Arun Goel's name was finalised after the Centre placed the original file of his appointment before the constitution bench. The Centre through Attorney General R Venkataramani said, "Please hold your mouth for a while. I request to look into the issue in entirety."

39.title: I make sure I keep up with Team India or I'll be left behind: Dhawan
39.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said he ensures that he keeps up with the pace of Team India as he's aware that he will be "left behind" otherwise. "I make sure that I keep myself in that groove," added Dhawan. "Having played for so many years...I handle pressure with...ease...It's about being positive [mentally] because life puts everybody down on their knees," he stated.

40.title: Fadnavis' statement on border issue provocative: Karnataka CM
40.article_body: Reacting to Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' statement on Karnataka-Maharashtra border issue, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that his statement is "provocative". "His dream will never come true. Our government is committed to protecting the country's land, water and borders," Bommai added. The reaction came after Fadnavis said that no village from Maharashtra will go anywhere.

41.title: I've great respect for Twitter staff working late into night: Musk
41.article_body: Appreciating the team working at Twitter, CEO Elon Musk said, "To be fair, there are many people at Twitter working late into the night, for whom I have great respect." He was responding to a tweet by a user, who said, "I heard you're working on a new banger book with Tim Ferris. 'The 40 hour work week'."

42.title: Tata Consumer stock rises by 2% after Bisleri stake sale talks
42.article_body: The stock of Tata Consumer Products Limited surged by over 2% on Thursday after Bisleri International Chairman Ramesh Chauhan reportedly said that he is in talks with the Tata Group firm to divest some of his stake. The deal is reportedly worth ₹6,000-7,000 crore. At 12:08 pm, Tata Consumer Products' stock was trading 1.90% higher at ₹784.80/share on the NSE.

43.title: Foxconn offers ₹1 lakh to new hires to leave China factory after violent clashes
43.article_body: After the violent clashes at the world's largest iPhone factory in China, Foxconn has started offering 10,000 yuan (around ₹1 lakh) to any new recruits who want to resign and leave the campus. Workers at the company protested against overdue pay and strict COVID-19 restrictions, following which Foxconn issued an apology and said there was a "technical error" during recruitment.

44.title: Delhi child rights body writes to NCERT over story 'perpetuating patriarchy'
44.article_body: Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights (DCPCR) Chairman Anurag Kundu has written a letter to NCERT over a chapter titled 'This Little Girl' in Class IX English textbook which "normalises violent masculinity, perpetuates patriarchy and promotes toxic behaviour in...family". He requested that the story should be modified or replaced from the textbook for the next academic session onwards.

45.title: Teenager, senior citizen among 6 people killed in Walmart shooting in US
45.article_body: A 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man have been identified as the youngest and the oldest victims of mass shooting at a Walmart store in the US state of Virginia. The oldest victim's cousin wrote on Facebook that he had worked at Walmart for many years and planned to retire next year. Police has not revealed details of minor victim.

46.title: Balika Vadhu actress Neha Marda announces pregnancy; shares pic
46.article_body: Actor Neha Marda has announced that she and her husband, Ayushman Agrawal, will soon become parents. She shared a photo with her husband and wrote, "Finally god has arrived in me...baby coming soon 2023." Neha, who married Ayushman in 2012, has acted in shows like Balika Vadhu, Doli Armaano Ki and Kyun Rishton Mein Katti Batti.

47.title: Couple with the world record of having the most body modifications have 98 mods now
47.article_body: The married couple Gabriela Peralta (Argentina) and Victor Hugo Peralta (Uruguay), who first set the Guinness World Record in 2014 with 84 body modifications, have a total of 98 modifications now. Together, they have 50 piercings, 14 body implants, five dental implants, four ear expanders and a forked tongue. The couple has been dubbed the "cherubs from hell".

48.title: Captaincy comes & goes, we come into the world empty-handed & leave empty-handed: Dhawan
48.article_body: On being asked whether he'd be conscious of "needing to improve" his strike-rate as PBKS captain, given he lost his captaincy at SRH as it affected his batting, Shikhar Dhawan said, "Jobs come and go...no worries." He added, "We come into the world empty-handed and leave empty-handed. All this just remains here...I don't feel any fear about losing the job."

49.title: If 'Gopi Kishan' gets remade, want only Ahan to do it: Suniel Shetty
49.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said that if his film 'Gopi Kishan' is ever remade, he would want his son Ahan Shetty to star in it. "I wouldn't want anyone else to do it. I think Ahan will do a great job," he shared. "With 'Gopi Kishan', I had an opportunity to showcase my talent...and also comic timing," the actor added.

50.title: Japan football team cleans up locker room after win over Germany; pic goes viral
50.article_body: After 24th ranked Japan defeated four time champions Germany in 2022 FIFA World Cup, the team cleaned up the locker room. FIFA's official Twitter account shared a picture and wrote, "After [a] historic victory...Japan fans cleaned up their rubbish in the stadium, whilst the team left their changing room at Khalifa International Stadium like this. Spotless."

51.title: The least they deserve is respect: Nadal on reaction to Argentina's loss
51.article_body: Talking about the reaction to Argentina's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their recent 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match, Rafael Nadal said, "The least they deserve is...respect." "The world hasn't changed. They simply lost a game," added Nadal. Discussing his team's morale after the loss against Saudi Arabia, Argentina captain Lionel Messi had termed it as "dead".

52.title: Man sets house of neighbour on fire in Greater Noida following argument
52.article_body: A man had allegedly set the house of his neighbour on fire in Greater Noida after an argument broke out between them when he went to purchase clothes from her. The woman asked the man to leave, following which the man set the pile of clothes on fire which spread rapidly into the house. The woman had a narrow escape.

53.title: Kamal Haasan discharged from hospital, advised two days rest
53.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's team has shared that the actor has been discharged from the hospital in Chennai and has been advised to take rest for two days. The actor was admitted to the hospital after complaining of uneasiness and fever. Kamal Haasan is currently busy with the shooting of his upcoming film 'Indian 2', which is being directed by Shankar.

54.title: Ludhiana RTO fined for giving same registration number for 2 vehicles
54.article_body: The Ludhiana District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission ordered a Regional Transport Office (RTO) to pay ₹7,500 to a man for issuing the same registration number for two vehicles. The complainant said he bought a vehicle from Delhi and applied for a new registration number in Ludhiana RTO. He later found out the same number was allotted to another person.

55.title: Don't know why I got this: De Bruyne on being named Player of the Match
55.article_body: Reacting to being named Player of the Match in Belgium's 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Canada, midfielder Kevin De Bruyne said, "I...[didn't play] a great game. I don't know why I got the trophy." "We didn't build up well...It wasn't good enough...We made it difficult for ourselves and that caused stress," he added. De Bruyne represents Manchester City.

56.title: Priyanka joins Rahul Gandhi for Bharat Jodo Yatra in Madhya Pradesh
56.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday joined her brother and party leader Rahul Gandhi in Madhya Pradesh for the Bharat Jodo Yatra. The Congress party tweeted a picture of the two, saying, "The steps will be strong when we walk together." This is the first time that Priyanka was seen being part of the Bharat Jodo Yatra.

57.title: Delhi's India Gate lawns to be temporarily shut amid heavy footfall
57.article_body: The lawns at Delhi's India Gate are being closed temporarily in sections to "give the grass a breather" amid heavy footfall, Central Public Works Department (CPWD) officials said. An official said that the CPWD is cordoning off sections for 15 days at a time. This intervention is only required on the two sections nearest to India Gate, the official added.

58.title: Hero Vired & INSEAD collaboratively launch a Product Management program
58.article_body: Hero Vired, Hero Group's EdTech company and INSEAD have collaboratively designed a new program on Data-Driven Product Management. The program equips students with a 360-degree understanding of product management including product development. The program includes placement assurance, masterclasses, workshops with industry experts and live sessions with the INSEAD faculty, Hero Vired stated.

59.title: Milma to increase price of milk by ₹6 from December 1 in Kerala
59.article_body: Milma has decided to increase the price of milk by ₹6 from December 1, Kerala Co-operative Milk Marketing Federation (KCMMF) Chairman KS Mani said on Wednesday. He added that ₹5.025 of the total hike will go to the farmers. The present hike will benefit the milk producers and entice more of them to join the dairy sector, he further said.

60.title: Over 40 people injured during firecracker show in Odisha
60.article_body: Over 40 people reportedly suffered burn injuries during a firecracker show at the immersion venue at Balia Bazaar in Odisha's Kendrapara town on Wednesday. "The mishap occurred when sparks from a cracker fell on a firecracker stock triggering a chain of explosion injuring all the people standing nearby," said an official. At least four victims were reported to be critical.

61.title: Only 1 team having a laugh now: Hamann on Rüdiger mocking Japan's Asano
61.article_body: Ex-Germany midfielder Didi Hamann termed Germany defender Antonio Rüdiger's decision to mock Japanese player Takuma Asano's running style during their recent 2022 FIFA World Cup match as "very unprofessional". "You don't belittle the opposition like that...He was having a laugh, there's only one team having a laugh now...I've got no explanation...for it," said Hamann. Japan recorded a 2-1 win.

62.title: BMC to take decision on Gokhale bridge reopening in 7 days
62.article_body: The decision to reopen the Gokhale bridge in Andheri, which is shut since November 7, is likely to come in next seven days. The BMC will take decision after going through the reports of Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute (VJTI) and Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT-B) which opined that it could be reopened for pedestrians and light motor vehicles (LMVs).

63.title: Measles poses imminent global threat due to pandemic: WHO & CDC
63.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have issued a joint report declaring measles an imminent threat globally as the pandemic weakened surveillance of the disease. A record high of nearly 40 million children missed a measles vaccine dose in 2021 due to hurdles created by the pandemic, the report mentioned.

64.title: Samantha is not hospitalised, she is resting at home: Actress' spokesperson
64.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's spokesperson has dismissed the reports that she has been hospitalised in Hyderabad. Reports claimed that Samantha, who was diagnosed with myositis this year, was admitted to a hospital after her health deteriorated on Wednesday. Her spokesperson told IndiaToday.in that Samantha is not hospitalised but is at home and resting.

65.title: Actress Richa Chadha criticised for insulting tweet on Indian Army
65.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha has been criticised for an insulting tweet on the Indian Army. While reacting to the statement of Northern Army Commander Lt General Upendra Dwivedi that the Indian Army is ready to execute orders like taking back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, she tweeted, "Galwan says hi." Twenty Indian soldiers were martyred in the Galwan clash.

66.title: Cover grey hair, no crew cut for males: Air India in new grooming rules for cabin crew
66.article_body: Air India has issued a new set of grooming guidelines for its cabin crew. Female crew members have been asked not to wear pearl earrings, only one bangle without design and no high top knots. The male crew members have been asked not to sport crew cuts. They have been asked to cover grey hair regularly in a natural shade.

67.title: Zetwerk-backer Kae Capital marks final close of 3rd fund at ₹767 cr
67.article_body: Venture capital firm Kae Capital has marked the final close of its third fund at ₹767 crore ($100 million). Through the fund, Kae Capital will invest in pre-Seed to pre-Series rounds. International and domestic institutional investors, family offices and startup founders participated in the fund. Kae Capital claims to be the first institutional investor in Tata 1MG and Zetwerk.

68.title: 6 lose vision in one eye after cataract surgery at UP hospital; FIR filed
68.article_body: Six villagers, aged between 55 and 78, have allegedly lost vision in one eye after undergoing cataract surgery at a private hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. An FIR has been filed against the eye surgeon and a local resident following a preliminary probe into the matter. Kanpur Chief Medical Officer told Indian Express that the hospital's licence was also revoked.

69.title: China sees highest daily COVID cases since start of pandemic as 31,444 test positive
69.article_body: China on Wednesday reported the highest number of daily COVID-19 cases since the start of the pandemic, according to official data. The number of new local cases was 31,444 on November 23, of which 3,927 were symptomatic and 27,517 were asymptomatic. The number broke the previous record set on April 13, when local cases hit 29,317.

70.title: Man steals luxury car to impress girlfriend in Pune, arrested
70.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested by Samarth police in Pune on the charges of stealing a luxury car allegedly to impress his girlfriend. According to the complainant, who deals in sales and purchase of luxury cars, accused Ishant Sharma borrowed a car from the showroom to show it off to his mother and girlfriend. Later, he escaped with the car.

71.title: Foxconn apologises for 'technical error' in hiring at China plant after clashes erupt
71.article_body: After violent protests broke out at the world's largest iPhone factory in China, Foxconn on Thursday said that a "technical error" occurred when hiring new recruits and apologised for it. While some workers complained they were forced to share dormitories with COVID-19-positive staff, others protested about overdue pay and COVID-19 restrictions. Several videos of the clashes also surfaced online.

72.title: My father, Messi can't be compared, they're different planets: Maradona's son
72.article_body: Late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona's son Diego Sinagra said comparisons between his father and Lionel Messi are made by those who "don't see and understand" football. "We are talking about two different planets," added Sinagra. Discussing Argentina's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Sinagra stated, "I am devastated...They were quite scared."

73.title: Musk tweets ‘#Stay@Work’ t-shirt after finding ‘#StayWoke’ t-shirts at Twitter
73.article_body: After finding a closet full of t-shirts with '#StayWoke' written on them at Twitter's headquarters, CEO Elon Musk tweeted a photo of a black t-shirt with "#Stay@Work" printed on it. "Awesome new Twitter merch!" Musk captioned the photo. This comes amid reports of mass resignations following Musk's ultimatum to commit to an "extremely hardcore" culture at Twitter or leave.

74.title: 233 measles cases, 12 deaths in Mumbai, nearby areas this year
74.article_body: Mumbai and nearby areas have reported 233 cases of measles so far this year, according to data released by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). As many as 12 patients have died, the latest victim being an eight-month-old boy from Bhiwandi. The baby, who was partially immunised, developed symptoms of measles and was put on life support, but he didn't survive.

75.title: Healthtech startup RedBrick AI raises $4.6 mn from Sequoia India, Surge
75.article_body: US-headquartered healthtech startup, RedBrick AI, has secured $4.6 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India and Southeast Asia's Surge. The funding round also saw participation from Y Combinator and angel investors. RedBrick AI was co-founded by University of Michigan alumni Shivam Sharma and Derek Lukacs, both having previously worked on SpaceX’s Hyperloop technology.

76.title: UG students get a hostel for the first time in 135 yrs of Hyd's Nizam College
76.article_body: After over 20 days of silent protest by about 300 girls of Hyderabad's Nizam College demanding a hostel for girls, the government approved their demand. The government decided to allocate a newly built, 76-room hostel building for 400 undergraduate girls - a first in the 135-year-old history of the college. UG girls were the only group without hostel accommodation.

77.title: UP to observe holiday on Nov 28 to mark Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas
77.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has announced a holiday on November 28 to mark the occasion of Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas. Guru Tegh Bahadur, who is the ninth Sikh Guru, was born in Amritsar in 1621 and was martyred under the rule of the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in 1675. Guru Tegh Bahadur is also popularly known as 'Hind di Chaddar'.

78.title: Remove encroachment on Senapati Bapat Marg in a month: HC to BMC
78.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ordered BMC's G North ward to clear illegal encroachment from the Senapati Bapat Marg in a month or face action. The encroachment in the Mahim area causes traffic snarls and difficulties for pedestrians. Four Mahim residents, who moved the HC against this, said that despite multiple requests to BMC, no permanent steps have been taken.

79.title: Kamal Haasan hospitalised in Chennai after complaining of uneasiness and fever: Reports
79.article_body: Kamal Haasan has reportedly been admitted to Sri Ramachandra Medical Centre (SRMC) hospital in Chennai, after complaining of uneasiness and fever. The 68-year-old actor, who was in Hyderabad a few days ago, was advised by doctors to rest. He is likely to get discharged on Thursday.

80.title: Everything I do or have done right is because of Priyanka: Nick
80.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas said that everything he does or has done right is because of Priyanka Chopra. Describing his relationship with Priyanka, Nick said that the two have a connection where they discuss their decisions on business, emotional and creative matters and even voice their opinions to each other. He said that all such conversations with Priyanka have been "invaluable".

81.title: No bigger proof of govt's 'inefficiency' than change of CMs in Guj: Cong MP
81.article_body: There can’t be a bigger proof of a government’s "inefficiency" than the move to change its CMs in BJP-ruled Gujarat, Congress MP Manish Tewari said. "What will be the plight of (current CM) is for public to decide. There cannot be a bigger living example of governance failure than the fact that you've to change your CMs thrice," Tewari added.

82.title: This was the most important game: Neuer after Germany's loss vs Japan
82.article_body: Germany captain Manuel Neuer said he's "totally frustrated" with the manner in which his team "gave up" during their 1-2 loss against Japan in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. "We're under pressure...This was the most important game," added Neuer. "The imperative that we wanted to score the second goal was...missing...We brought Japan back into the game," he stated.

83.title: Even if I die, continue peaceful protests: Farmer leader on fast to followers
83.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal, whose fast entered its fifth day on Wednesday, said, "Even if I die, I appeal to farmer colleagues to carry out their protests in a peaceful manner." Dallewal has pledged to fast unto death till the Punjab government agrees to various demands of the farmers.

84.title: Tata Consumer to acquire Bisleri for about ₹7,000 crore: Report
84.article_body: Ramesh Chauhan is divesting Bisleri International to Tata Consumer Products Limited for about ₹6,000-7,000 crore, as per a report. The report added that Chauhan doesn't have a successor to take Bisleri to the next level of expansion. Chauhan reportedly called it a "painful" decision and said that The Tata Group "will nurture and take care of it even better."

85.title: German officials learn cricket from Indian colleagues at Consulate General; video viral
85.article_body: German Consul in Bengaluru, Achim Burkart, took to Twitter to share a video and wrote, "During lunch break my Indian colleagues try to teach my German colleagues how to play cricket." "Happy to report that the consulate is still intact," he added. The video shared by Burkart went viral on social media.

86.title: Nirav Modi seeks permission to appeal extradition in UK Supreme Court
86.article_body: Fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi filed an application in the High Court in London, seeking permission to appeal against his extradition order in UK Supreme Court. He is currently behind bars at London's Wandsworth prison. The court had rejected his appeal earlier this month while ordering his extradition to India to face charges in the ₹14,000-crore Punjab National Bank scam case.

87.title: Over 43,000 people fined for not wearing seat belts in Mumbai
87.article_body: At least 43,689 drivers and passengers have been fined by Mumbai Traffic Police for not wearing seat belts, including both front and rear, since November 1. According to official data, 22,970 challans were issued to drivers and 20,719 to passengers. Wearing rear seat belts has been made mandatory since November 10.

88.title: Bombay HC denies divorce to Pune man who lied about wife being HIV+
88.article_body: The Bombay High Court rejected the divorce petition of a 44-year-old Pune resident who falsely claimed that his wife was HIV positive and sought divorce on that ground. The man claimed that his wife while undergoing treatment for "herpes" in 2004 tested positive for HIV. However, the man failed to submit any proof to the court to substantiate his claim.

89.title: 'Should Twitter offer a general amnesty to suspended accounts?' Musk launches new poll
89.article_body: Days after reinstating several banned Twitter accounts, Elon Musk on Wednesday held another poll on whether the site should offer a "general amnesty" to suspended accounts, provided the users have not broken the law. Earlier, Musk ran a similar poll asking Twitter users if former US President Donald Trump's account should be reinstated, following which 51.8% voted yes.

90.title: Scindia to inaugurate airport multilevel parking tomorrow: Pune MP
90.article_body: Pune MP Girish Bapat has said that Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia will inaugurate the multilevel parking at the airport in the city tomorrow. "The parking lot will also provide other facilities to passengers," he added. Earlier, Airports Authority of India said that Indian Air Force has approved over 200 slots daily for civil flight operations for Pune airport.

91.title: Comedy movies never get their due, it's not easy: Kiara Advani
91.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said that doing comedy on screen looks easy but it's "very difficult" for the actors to perform. "It (comedy movies) never gets its due but it's not easy," she expressed. Director Shashank Khaitan said, "Comedy is the toughest to do...it's the toughest to write, act and direct." Kiara's next film is Shashank's upcoming directorial 'Govinda Naam Mera'.

92.title: Man's flight ticket shows 2 destinations and departures, social media users react
92.article_body: A passenger named Auditya Venkatesh was booking an AirAsia flight ticket from Hyderabad to Bengaluru when his arrival and departure were mixed up in the confirmation popup, showing he was booking ticket from Hyderabad to Bengaluru as well as from Bengaluru to Kolkata. While AirAsia said it was a "glitch", a Twitter user wrote, "Bro's travelling in the multiverse now."

93.title: Pic of Senegal's football team coach goes viral for his resemblance to Snoop Dogg
93.article_body: A picture of Senegal football coach Aliou Cisse is going viral on social media as several users pointed out that he looks like American rapper Snoop Dogg. The rapper reacted to the picture of Cisse with a football emoticon. "Why is Snoop Dogg the coach of Senegal?" read a tweet posted by a user.

94.title: Housing projects issued notices seeking ₹14,184 cr dues in Gr Noida
94.article_body: Greater Noida Authority has issued notices to 143 housing projects in the city seeking recovery of ₹14,184 crore dues. "If...realtors fail to pay their respective dues, we'll have to cancel their allotment according to the terms of the lease-deed," an official of the agency said. Moreover, an official of the Noida Authority said that it issued 15 more recovery notices.

95.title: ICC releases latest ODI team rankings, England lose top spot
95.article_body: The ICC has released the latest ODI team rankings, with England losing their top spot following a 0-3 defeat against Australia in the recently concluded three-match ODI series. New Zealand are on top of the rankings with 114 rating points, while England are now second with 113 rating points. India are third, while Australia are ranked fourth.

96.title: SL cricketer Chamika Karunaratne banned for 1 year over indiscipline at T20 WC
96.article_body: Sri Lanka all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne has been handed a one-year ban by Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) over indiscipline. The 26-year-old was found to have breached multiple clauses of the SLC's player agreement during the recently concluded T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The all-rounder pleaded guilty to all charges levelled against him. He has also been fined $5,000.

97.title: World’s 6th richest man Buffett donates $758 million in Berkshire shares to charity
97.article_body: Warren Buffett has donated Berkshire Hathaway's shares valued at more than $758 million to charities, including one named after his late wife. With a net worth of  $110.4 billion, 92-year-old Buffett is the world's sixth richest person. Since 2006, Buffett has donated over half of his Berkshire shares, worth more than $46 billion at the time of the donations.

98.title: 14-yr-old boy proposes 13-yr-old girl on social media, booked in Pune
98.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, a Class 8 student, has reportedly been booked by Pune Police for proposing to his 13-year-old classmate on social media. The boy posted pictures of the girl on social media, asking her to be his wife. However, the girl informed her parents about it. "We have issued a notice to the boy's parents," said police.

99.title: Actor Vikram Gokhale's daughter dismisses death reports, says 'He's on life support'
99.article_body: Actor Vikram Gokhale's daughter has dismissed reports about his death, saying that his condition is still critical and he is on life support. "Keep praying for him," she further said. Gokhale, who has starred in several Bollywood films including 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa', won the National Award for the best actor for Marathi film 'Anumati'.

100.title: Donald Trump reported $900 million in losses in 2 years, jury told
100.article_body: Donald Trump's longtime accountant has testified that the ex-US president reported losses on his tax returns every year for a decade, confirming long-held suspicions about his tax practices. Trump reported losses of $700 million in 2009 and $200 million in 2010, Donald Bender said. Bender was the first defence witness in the tax fraud trial of two of Trump's companies.

101.title: 'Should Twitter offer amnesty to suspended accounts?' asks Musk, starts poll
101.article_body: Billionaire CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday started a poll on Twitter asking users if the platform should "offer a general amnesty to suspended accounts". He said the amnesty will only be offered to accounts that "haven't broken the law or engaged in egregious spam". In the poll's initial hours, over 72% votes of 1.2 million polled votes were for 'Yes'.

102.title: I didn't form content moderation council as 'activist groups' broke the deal: Musk
102.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said he reinstated previously banned Twitter accounts before the platform got a content moderation council as "a large coalition of political/social activist groups...broke the deal". "[They had] agreed not to try to kill Twitter by starving us of advertising revenue if I [formed the council]," Musk said. He earlier reinstated billionaire Donald Trump's Twitter.

103.title: New York becomes 1st US state to restrict cryptocurrency mining
103.article_body: New York Governor Kathy Hochul on Tuesday signed a law temporarily restricting cryptocurrency mining in the state over environmental concerns, making it the first US state to do so. For the next two years, unless a proof-of-work mining company uses 100% renewable energy, it won't be allowed to expand or renew permits. New entrants won't be allowed to come online.

104.title: ED seizes FD worth ₹16 cr from Hyd-based firm for FEMA violation
104.article_body: Fixed deposits worth ₹16 crore, belonging to a Hyderabad-based firm, which provides seismic survey services to oil exploration companies in India and abroad, have been seized by the ED for violating the foreign exchange law. The action was taken against Alphageo (India) Limited, which was raided by the Income Tax Department in 2019, the ED said.

105.title: Karnataka govt constitutes an elephant task force
105.article_body: The Karnataka government set up an elephant task force to check the menace caused by the wild animal in the state. The Deputy Conservator of Forests will head the task force and it'll be set up in Hassan, Chikkamagaluru, Mysuru and Kodagu districts where the problem has peaked. Every task force headquarter will have a phone number shared with citizens.

106.title: Spain record their biggest-ever win in FIFA World Cup history
106.article_body: Spain on Wednesday defeated Costa Rica 7-0 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. It's their biggest-ever victory in FIFA World Cup history. Their previous biggest win in FIFA World Cup history had come in the 1998 edition, when they defeated Bulgaria 6-1. Ferran Torres scored a brace for Spain today, while remaining goals were scored by five different players.

107.title: Taliban publicly lashes 12 people, including three women, in Afghanistan
107.article_body: The Taliban lashed twelve people, including three women, at a provincial stadium in Logar on Wednesday. The lashings were attended by hundreds of spectators, following invitations being sent out by the administration. The lashings were announced after the individuals were convicted by a local court of theft or adultery. Each individual received between 21 and 39 lashes.

108.title: Russia continues to batter Ukraine's power grid
108.article_body: Russia on Wednesday continued to batter Ukraine's power grid with multiple air strikes. Several regions in the country reported power outages. There was no official confirmation on how many infrastructure targets were hit. Meanwhile, authorities said three people died when one of the air strikes hit a two-storey building in capital Kyiv.

109.title: Over 80,000 delegates will attend COP28 In Dubai: UAE minister
109.article_body: At least 80,000 delegates, including over 140 senior foreign government leaders, will attend COP28, which will be held in Dubai next year, said UAE Minister Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber. He said the Gulf nation has invested over $50 billion in clean energy projects. The UAE is also the home of the International Renewable Energy Agency's headquarters.

110.title: Ambuja Cements releases pledge of 50.05% in its subsidiary ACC
110.article_body: Ambuja Cement has released the existing pledge of 50.05% shareholding in its subsidiary ACC as of November 19, it said in a stock exchange filing. After the release, Ambuja's holding pledged with lenders has come down to 2.16% from 52.21% earlier. The company had pledged its total 9.39 crore shares of ACC on September 26.

111.title: European Parliament's website hit by cyberattack
111.article_body: The European Parliament's website on Wednesday was hit by a cyberattack by a pro-Russia group, said the legislature's President Roberta Metsola. The cyber attack came just hours after European Parliament lawmakers supported a resolution to declare Russia a state sponsor of terrorism. Metsola said a "pro-Kremlin group has claimed responsibility" for the "sophisticated cyberattack".

112.title: Volkswagen-owned brands halt paid activities on Twitter
112.article_body: Volkswagen, owner of Audi, Seat, Cupra, Lamborghini, Bentley, Ducati and Porsche, said that it recommended all its brands pause paid activities on Twitter, after Elon Musk took ownership of the social media platform. Audi has halted all activities, a Volkswagen spokesperson said. "We are monitoring the situation closely and will decide on the next steps depending on developments," Audi said.

113.title: Jain given dry fruits in jail, why no action taken against admin: Baghel
113.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel reacted to videos of jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain from his cell, questioning why Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal hasn't removed Jain from his post. "[Jain] has been provided with a masseur and dry fruits. How these things are being given to him?" Baghel said. "What action has been taken against the jail administration?" he further said.

114.title: Telcos' adjusted gross revenue rises 17.91% YoY to ₹60,530 cr in Q1: TRAI
114.article_body: Telecom service providers' adjusted gross revenue (AGR) grew 17.91% on a year-over-year basis to ₹60,530 crore in April-June quarter, according to data by Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). The AGR of telecom service providers stood at ₹51,335 crore in June 2021 quarter. Bharti Airtel recorded the highest growth in year-over-year AGR by 25.15% to ₹17,140.56 crore.

115.title: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore's nephew found hanging at his home in Lucknow
115.article_body: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore's nephew, Nand Kishore, was found hanging at his home in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Wednesday. Preliminary investigation suggests that Nand Kishore, who used to work as a property dealer, died by suicide. According to Nand Kishore's son Vishal, his father was troubled for the past few days. Police said he had married twice.

116.title: Why didn't Ronaldo receive ₹168 crore payoff from Man Utd over contract termination?
116.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo didn't receive £17-million (₹168-crore) payoff from Manchester United despite his contract being terminated prematurely. United were confident they had strong legal grounds to sue for contract breach given "unauthorised and damaging" nature of Ronaldo's interview with Piers Morgan, The Telegraph reported. Ronaldo's team reportedly agreed for no compensation to avoid legal battle.

117.title: Europe names John McFall as world's first specially-abled astronaut
117.article_body: The European Space Agency on Wednesday named the first ever "parastronaut". The agency said it selected former British Paralympic sprinter John McFall as part of a new generation of 17 recruits picked for astronaut training. He'll take part in a feasibility study designed to allow ESA to assess conditions needed for people with disabilities to take part in future missions.

118.title: Bihar people in Maha were safe under MVA govt: Aaditya Thackeray
118.article_body: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday said people from Bihar were safe in Maharashtra under the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. There were no incidents of violence against people of Bihar under the erstwhile government, the MLA claimed. Earlier in the day, he met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar. Maharashtra was ruled by the MVA government till June 29.

119.title: 450 Celtic coins stolen from German museum
119.article_body: As many as 450 Celtic coins, valued at millions of euros, were stolen from the Roman-Celtic Museum in Germany's Manching town, police said. The heist came to light on Tuesday after employees at the museum found a "showcase was broken". "The loss of the Celtic treasure is a disaster,'' said Markus Blume, Minister of Science and Arts, Bavaria.

120.title: Kanye showed porn, Kim's explicit video in meetings: Former Yeezy, Adidas staff
120.article_body: Rapper Kanye West played pornography, showed his sex tapes as well as explicit video and photos of her former wife Kim Kardashian to Yeezy and Adidas team members, Rolling Stone reported citing former employees. He even showed an intimate photograph of Kim in job interviews. Adidas Yeezy was a fashion collaboration between Kanye and Adidas which ended in October 2022.

121.title: Anupam shares pic with filmmakers as he celebrates 'successful 2022'
121.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared videos and pictures with filmmakers R Balki, Aanand L Rai, Luv Ranjan, Madhur Bhandarkar and Kabir Khan on Instagram as he celebrated his "success in the year 2022" and his film 'Uunchai'. "I am an ardent admirer of each one of you. This is the best gift one could ever ask for," Anupam captioned the post.

122.title: BJP publicising fake videos due to fear of losing MCD polls: Sisodia
122.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday criticised the BJP and claimed the party is publicising fake videos due to the fear of losing MCD elections. His comment comes after Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's videos from Tihar jail surfaced online. "Congress and BJP are demanding the resignation of Satyendar Jain, therefore AAP is seen on the backfoot regarding...[him]," Sisodia said.

123.title: Gangster Amar Naik's aide traced 23 yrs after jumping bail in Maha; held
123.article_body: Ravindra Dhole, an alleged gang member of late gangster Amar Naik, was arrested on Tuesday from Maharashtra's Pune, an officer said. Dhole, who was arrested in 1998 in connection with a dacoity case, had jumped bail in 1999. "We didn't have as much as his photograph as, at that point, photo records of all accused weren't maintained," police said.

124.title: Several injured as school bus overturns near Jharkhand-Bengal border
124.article_body: A school bus overturned near the Jharkhand-West Bengal border on Wednesday. The incident took place in the Bhalupahadi area of Bardhaman, ANI reported. Several children, who were injured in the accident, are currently being treated. Pictures of injured children have surfaced on social media.

125.title: FDI equity inflows drop 14% during April-September to $26.9 bn: DPIIT
125.article_body: Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) equity inflows into India contracted by 14% to $26.9 billion during April-September this fiscal, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) data showed. The inflows were $31.15 billion during the corresponding period of the previous year. During the first half of this fiscal, Singapore emerged as the top investor with $10 billion FDI.

126.title: Goldman Sachs expects Nifty50 to reach 20,500 by 2023-end
126.article_body: Goldman Sachs on Wednesday said that it expects Nifty50, the NSE's benchmark index, to reach 20,500 by end of 2023, implying about 12% price returns from current levels. It expects Nifty profits to grow 15% in 2023 and 2024. Goldman Sachs has forecast India's GDP growth to slow to 5.9% year-on-year in 2023 from 6.9% in 2022.

127.title: Genocide: Meghalaya ex-CM blames Assam Police for deaths in border clash
127.article_body: Ex-Meghalaya CM Mukul Sangma on Wednesday said Assam Police personnel had committed "genocide" by "killing unarmed villagers" in the recent border clash between Assam and Meghalaya. "The incident occurred well within the jurisdiction of the state of Meghalaya...Action must be taken against the culprits," he said. As many as six people, including a forest guard, were killed in the firing.

128.title: Man who cheated actor Annu Kapoor of ₹4.36 lakh in KYC fraud arrested
128.article_body: A 28-year-old man has been arrested from Mumbai's Andheri, almost two months after he allegedly cheated actor Annu Kapoor of ₹4.36 lakh under the pretext of updating his bank KYC details, police said. The accused, Ashish Paswan, is a native of Darbhanga in Bihar. He reportedly earns commission by helping people open bank accounts, an official said.

129.title: Centre deploys teams as measles cases surge in Ranchi, Ahmedabad
129.article_body: The Centre has deployed high-level teams to Ranchi, Ahmedabad and Malappuram amid an increase in the number of measles cases among children there. The Health Ministry said the teams will assist the state health authorities in investigating the outbreak. They will also facilitate operationalisation of requisite control and containment, it added.

130.title: Meta pauses AI bot Galactica demo after complaints of fake research
130.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta shut down its artificial intelligence (AI) bot Galactica following complaints from users that it was faking research papers. Galactica was introduced as a bot that can "summarise academic literature, solve math problems, generate Wiki articles, write scientific code, annotate molecules and proteins, and more". The bot demo was shut two days after its launch.

131.title: There's no rift in party: K'taka Cong on reports of poll tickets row
131.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday stated that there is no rift in the party, adding, "The entire Congress is united. We are one." He was commenting on reports about Congress leaders fighting over ticket distribution for the upcoming Karnataka Assembly elections. Shivakumar further stated that he is confident that people of Karnataka will vote in favour of Congress.

132.title: We can make a scooter in 40 secs with expanded capacity: Ather Co-founder
132.article_body: Ather Energy's Co-founder Swapnil Jain said company can produce around 1,200 scooters daily with the expanded capacity, and a vehicle takes 40 seconds to be made. Company has increased its production to 4.20 lakh vehicles per annum through its new plant in Hosur, Tamil Nadu. Company is targeting annual sales of 26,000 to 30,000 units by FY23 end, he added.

133.title: JD(S) open to CM from minority community if party comes to power: HDK
133.article_body: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has said the party is ready to accommodate a CM from the minority or backward communities if elected to power in the Karnataka Assembly elections next year. "Muslims are our own people...They are Kannadigas too...This is...about...addressing the issues of that community," he added. Kumaraswamy further said the party aims to win 123 Assembly seats.

134.title: Andhra CM Jagan Reddy calls Chandrababu Naidu 'backstabber'
134.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy called Telugu Desam Party President N Chandrababu Naidu a "backstabber". "If someone establishes his own party and comes to power on his own, he is called...a Jagan. If you usurp a political party and even the Chief Minister's chair from your father-in-law...such a person is called Chandrababu," he added.

135.title: Actress Aindrila's sister shares post after her death, says 'Without you, I'm crippled'
135.article_body: Bengali actress Aindrila Sharma's sister Aishwarya Sharma penned a note following her demise. "Without you I am crippled...Who will dress me up ? Who will take my picture ? Who will understand the unspoken words from my mouth?" she wrote. "In these 24 years, I have not learnt to do anything on my own sister," her post read.

136.title: Law & order deteriorated under DMK rule: AIADMK's EPS to TN Governor
136.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday met Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi at Raj Bhavan in Chennai and said the law and order situation has deteriorated under DMK rule in the last 18 months. EPS said that despite warnings from central intelligence agencies, the state government had not taken measures to prevent the Coimbatore blast on October 23.

137.title: Daughter Sara reminds me to be humble in interactions: Saif Ali Khan
137.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that his daughter and actress Sara Ali Khan keeps reminding him to be humble in interactions. "Sara doesn't like offending people or acting smart with people who act smart. She has a calm...polite way, ego doesn't get in the way," he added. Saif stated his son Ibrahim is a "fun and chill guy".

138.title: Kirti was into herself during shoot of 'Four...' season 3: Maanvi
138.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo has reacted to her 'Four More Shots Please!' co-star Kirti Kulhari's statement where she said that she is not that close to co-stars Maanvi, Sayani Gupta and Bani J. "In this season, Kirti was very much into herself. She preferred spending a lot of time alone and we girls totally respected that," Maanvi stated.

139.title: AIIMS Delhi server down for 15 hours due to suspected cyberattack
139.article_body: AIIMS Delhi on Wednesday said the hospital's server has been down for 15 hours, resulting in digital services like smart lab, billing and report generation of outpatient and inpatient departments getting affected. "National Informatics Centre team...has informed that this may be a ransomware attack," AIIMS said. The hospital's registration process is being handled manually and is causing delays.

140.title: Bhumi Pednekar took my first audition, she has midas touch: Kiara
140.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, while promoting 'Govinda Naam Mera' with Bhumi Pednekar and Vicky Kaushal, revealed that Bhumi took her very first audition. Reacting to this, Vicky stated Bhumi took his audition too. Describing the audition, Kiara said, "It was not for anything. You just have to go and audition...they'll find a film." Kiara added Bhumi has the "midas touch".

141.title: IAS officer shares society notice asking delivery workers to not use lift, people react
141.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared an undated photo of a notice pasted outside a lift entrance. It states that only residents are allowed to use the lift and others, including delivery workers, shouldn't use it. "Can you deliver the food or delivery bag to...20th floor by using staircase?" a person commented while another Twitter user called it "class divide".

142.title: Saudi Arabia player reveals he screamed 'You will not win' at Messi in viral video
142.article_body: Saudi Arabia defender Ali Al-Bulayhi has revealed what he screamed at Lionel Messi during his side's 2-1 victory over Argentina in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Tuesday. After a video showing Al-Bulayhi shouting something at Messi after Saudi Arabia scored their second goal went viral, the defender revealed he was saying, "You will not win...you will not win!"

143.title: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of ODI series against Bangladesh
143.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of the upcoming ODI series against Bangladesh. The BCCI, in a statement, said that Jadeja is yet to recover from his knee injury and he will continue to be under the supervision of the BCCI's medical team. Jadeja had also missed the T20 World Cup 2022 due to the injury.

144.title: I never got a call from them: Manish Pandey on LSG releasing him
144.article_body: Reacting to being released by Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2023, batter Manish Pandey said, "I never got a call [from them]." He added, "I just got to know about it on the day the list was announced. There was no real communication." He further said, "They wanted to release me and get some extra money."

145.title: Starbucks awarded ₹13 lakh in case against Jaipur cafe over 'Frappuccino'
145.article_body: Delhi High Court has awarded over ₹13 lakh to US-based coffee chain Starbucks in its lawsuit against a Jaipur cafe for trademark infringement. The court permanently restrained the cafe from using Starbucks' registered 'Frappuccino' trademark to sell its products. "The adoption of the 'Frappuccino' mark by the Jaipur cafe is dishonest and intended to deceive unwary consumers," the court said.

146.title: India to export further 2-4 mn tonnes of sugar this season: Industry body
146.article_body: India is likely to allow a further 2-4 million tonnes of sugar exports in 2022/23 season, Indian Sugar Mills Association (ISMA) said. ISMA President Aditya Jhunjhunwala said India would likely produce 36 million tonnes of sugar. India consumes around 27-27.5 million tonnes, leaving 8.5-9 million tonnes for export, he said. Government has already approved sugar export of 6 million tonnes.

147.title: Wipro becomes 1st Indian IT company to allow employees to form union in Europe
147.article_body: Wipro has become the first Indian IT services company to allow its employees to unionise in Europe. The company has entered into an agreement with employee representatives to set up a European Works Council (EWC) following a request by employees in 2019. The employees belong to 13 countries including France, Sweden, Finland and Germany.

148.title: I-T dept raids 40 locations related to oil & pulses traders in TN
148.article_body: Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted searches at 40 locations of five major suppliers of pulses and palm oil to Public Distribution System shops in Tamil Nadu. "We found that proper accounts weren't maintained by these companies...We also suspect that there's been tax evasion," said a senior I-T official. The searches are reportedly expected to continue for a few days.

149.title: Tax collection to exceed budget estimate by ₹4 lakh cr: Revenue Secretary
149.article_body: India's tax collection will exceed the total budget estimate of ₹27.50 lakh crore by nearly ₹4 lakh crore in the current fiscal, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said. Bajaj said the direct tax collection comprising personal and corporate taxes would be about ₹17.50 lakh crore this year. Collection from indirect taxes, customs, excise and GST, would be nearly ₹14 lakh crore.

150.title: CEC can't be weak, should be able to take action against PM: SC
150.article_body: The Supreme Court said the country needs a Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) who isn't weak-kneed and can take action against the Prime Minister, if needed. "The CEC is supposed to be insulated from political influence and should be independent," the top court said. Yesterday, the Supreme Court said that CEC of strong character like late TN Seshan is needed.

151.title: Assam govt demands CBI probe in border firing incident
151.article_body: Assam Minister Jayanta Mallabaruah said that the state government has requested the central government to order a probe by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) into the firing incident along the Assam-Meghalaya border. The incident which killed five people from Meghalaya and one Assam Forest Guard happened on Tuesday. The Assam Congress alleged that the firing was a "deliberate incident".

152.title: Polygraph test postponed as Aftab falls sick, likely to take place tomorrow
152.article_body: The polygraph test that Aftab Poonawala was supposed to undergo on Wednesday has been cancelled as he has fallen sick. According to reports, this could affect the results of the test, because of which the test is likely to take place tomorrow. Shraddha, in a complaint that she filed in 2020, had said that Aftab had threatened to kill her.

153.title: Shocked: SP MLA Rais Shaikh after visiting municipal school in Bhiwandi
153.article_body: Samajwadi Party MLA Rais Shaikh said he was shocked to see state of school run by Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) after he visited one in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. "It's been 75 years since independence but we still haven't been able to provide desks and benches to our children?" Shaikh tweeted. "I sat with the students on the floor," he added.

154.title: Kumaraswamy apologises as viral video shows him abusing Congress MLA
154.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy apologised on Wednesday after a video of him using abusive language against Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar went viral. "I regret if my word has hurt...Kumar," the ex-Karnataka CM said. He claimed he had uttered an expletive as he was sad to see the poor condition of a government school in Srinivaspur. Kumar represents Srinivaspur constituency.

155.title: 6 killed in US' Virginia as Walmart manager opens fire at employees
155.article_body: A Walmart manager shot dead six fellow employees and wounded several others at a store in the US' Virginia state on Tuesday night, authorities said on Wednesday. The suspected gunman reportedly fatally shot himself before the police found him. So far, no clear motive has been found behind the shooting.

156.title: Military will crush attempts at regime change: Sri Lankan Prez
156.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Wednesday he will use the military to crush any future anti-government protests in the country that aim at regime change. He further rejected the Opposition's demand for early elections, saying the Parliament will not be dissolved till the ongoing economic crisis is resolved. Wickremesinghe's current mandate as president is till November 2024.

157.title: Pak PM Sharif to appoint next Army chief; receives list of candidates
157.article_body: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif is set to appoint the country's next Army chief after the military submitted a list of six senior Army generals as candidates. "The prime minister will take a decision on the appointments as per the laid down procedure," the Prime Minister's Office said. Incumbent Army chief General Qamar Bajwa will retire on November 29.

158.title: Travellers with single name on Indian passports not allowed to travel to UAE
158.article_body: Passengers with a single name on Indian passports on tourist, visitor or other visas won't be allowed to travel to and from UAE. Both first and last names are required on passports. Travel will be allowed to passengers with a single name with a residence permit or employment visa, provided the same name is in 'First Name' and 'Surname' columns.

159.title: Sena's Aaditya Thackeray meets Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav in Patna
159.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray, along with party MP Priyanka Chaturvedi, met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday. "We've been in touch with each other but could not meet due to COVID-19...Sure this friendship will continue," Aaditya said. "The current challenge is to save the law and...democracy," Tejashwi Yadav said.

160.title: Dislocated both shoulders while filming 'Kantara': Rishab Shetty
160.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty revealed that he dislocated both his shoulders while filming 'Kantara', however, he continued the shoot. "While rehearsing for the pre-climax, I began having issues with my shoulder. During a 360-degree shot, I dislocated one shoulder. On the very next day, I dislocated my other shoulder as well during shooting," he added. Rishab also directed and wrote 'Kantara'.

161.title: Andhra CM equates self with NTR, calls Chandrababu Naidu 'Ravana'
161.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy on Wednesday equated himself with former CM NT Rama Rao (NTR). He said, "If someone establishes his own party and comes to power on his own, he is called...NTR or...Jagan." Further, he called TDP MLA Chandrababu Naidu "Ravana". Reddy said Naidu had seized the Chief Minister's chair from NTR, who was his father-in-law.

162.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha uses dialogue from 'Sholay' during rally in Guj
162.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha used a dialogue from 'Sholay' to state the effect Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's presence has had on corrupt people. "Today, when any corrupt man cries within miles of Gujarat, his mother tells him, 'So ja beta warna Kejriwal aa jayega'," Chadha said. Kejriwal was born to end corruption and curb rising prices, he added.

163.title: If BJP fails in horse-trading attempts, it uses agencies to harass leaders: TRS MLC
163.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Wednesday criticised the BJP and said if the party fails in horse-trading attempts, it uses central agencies to harass leaders of opposition parties. "The only policy that BJP preaches is 'Ram-Ram Japna, Paraya Leader Apna'," she said. Addressing TRS members in Yellareddy, she asked why BJP is evading SIT probe if they did nothing wrong.

164.title: Madras HC imposes ₹35,000 fine on 2 people for fake allegations against police
164.article_body: Madras HC has reportedly imposed a fine of ₹35,000 on two petitioners who made fake allegations against police personnel. The amount will be distributed equally among seven police officials, against whom the petitioners had sought to initiate disciplinary action. The concerned police officials had earlier initiated action against the petitioners for running an orphanage illegally.

165.title: 24th-ranked Japan defeat 4-time champions Germany in 2022 FIFA World Cup
165.article_body: Japan, who are the 24th ranked team in the world, defeated four-time champions Germany 2-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Wednesday. Germany's İlkay Gündoğan opened the scoring in the match by converting a penalty in the 33rd minute. Ritsu Doan equalised in the 75th minute, before Takuma Asano netted the winner in the 83rd minute.

166.title: Disha Salian's case was not with us, how can we conclude it: CBI
166.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday dismissed news reports stating that the agency has concluded Disha Salian's death case as an accident. "The Disha case was not with us, so how can we conclude anything?" a CBI official told Free Press Journal. "Moreover, the HC already rejected a PIL seeking a CBI probe into Disha's case," he added.

167.title: Kanye West says he will run for 2024 US Presidential elections
167.article_body: In a video posted by a Twitter account, Kanye West was asked if he'll be running for the 2024 US Presidential elections. To this, Kanye replied, "Yes...It's simple...It's just we're moving toward the future." Kanye took to Twitter and wrote, "What [do] you guys think [Donald Trump's] response was when I asked him to be my running mate in 2024?"

168.title: Google to restore parliament's YouTube or pay 1 bn rubles: Russia
168.article_body: A Russian court ordered Google to restore the YouTube channel of the State Duma, Russia's parliament, or pay a fine of 100 thousand rubles per day until it reaches 1 billion rubles, the Duma said. The parliament also asked Google to not treat the Duma like they did US President Donald Trump and cut off all its communication.

169.title: Told Leonardo 'You'll give screen test or you're out': Cameron on Titanic
169.article_body: Filmmaker James Cameron revealed actor Leonardo DiCaprio nearly lost his role in 'Titanic' during the film's screen test. DiCaprio said that he doesn't give screen tests, to which, Cameron told him, "You're going to read, or you're not going to get the part." Later, Leonardo did give the screen test and Cameron cast him as Jack in the film.

170.title: Ex-Odisha minister Golak Bihari passes away; President condoles death
170.article_body: Former Odisha minister Golak Bihari Naik passed away at a private nursing home on Wednesday. The former Udala MLA began his political career with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and later joined the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). The leader was aged above 60. Condoling his demise, President Droupadi Murmu said, "In his death, we have lost an affable people's leader."

171.title: Indians without full name on passports will be barred from entering UAE
171.article_body: Indians who don't have their full name on their passports won't be allowed to fly to or out of UAE, according to new rules which came into effect on Monday. Passengers travelling to UAE on residential or employment visas are, however, exempted from the rule. "We're...awaiting information from the embassy [on this]," a UAE-based travel agency told Khaleej Times.

172.title: 4 mobiles, 2 battery chargers recovered inside Punjab's Kapurthala jail
172.article_body: Four mobile phones and two battery chargers were recovered from Punjab's Kapurthala Central Jail's high-security zone after a surprise check on Wednesday, officials said. Jail Superintendent Iqbal Singh Dhaliwal said the administration has been conducting surprise checks to check the use of mobile phones. He added that they've written to Kapurthala Kotwali Police Station for further action.

173.title: Assets of 9 major ports being considered for monetisation: MoS for Ports
173.article_body: Union Minister Shantanu Thakur, addressing the PM Gati Shakti Multimodal Maritime Summit 2022, said assets of nine major ports are considered for monetisation between FY22-25 under National Monetisation Programme, according to a FICCI release. He added that development of 11 industrial corridors and two defence industrial corridors is planned to improve operational efficiency of existing assets.
