174.title: Germany players cover mouths for World Cup photo to protest pro-LGBTQ armband ban
174.article_body: Germany players covered their mouths with hands during team photo before their 2022 FIFA World Cup Group E encounter against Japan to protest pro-LGBTQ 'OneLove' armband ban. Earlier, seven European captains decided not to wear the armbands after FIFA stated they'll receive a yellow card if they do so. FIFA had also warned of sanctions against teams over the armband.

175.title: Coinbase holds 2 mn Bitcoin: CEO after Binance CEO questions its holdings
175.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase's CEO Brian Armstrong said that the company holds around 2 million Bitcoin worth $39.9 billion as of September 30, 2022. "If you see FUD (fear, uncertainty and doubt) out there - remember, our financials are public," Armstrong tweeted. This comes after Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao's tweet that questioned Coinbase's Bitcoin holdings, which has now been deleted.

176.title: Russia's Gazprom threatens to cut gas supply to Europe through Ukraine
176.article_body: Gazprom has threatened to reduce natural gas supplies through the last pipeline heading to Europe via Ukraine, claiming the amount it supplies for Moldova is not reaching the country. Gazprom said Moldova's Moldovagaz has paid for part of its November gas flows under its contract. Ukraine dismissed the claims, saying all supplies that Russia sent were "fully transferred" to Moldova.

177.title: Bidders for bankrupt Reliance Capital seek extension for bidding deadline
177.article_body: Multiple companies have written to the Reliance Capital Administrator for an extension for submitting binding bids for Anil Ambani's company, claiming they need more time to finalise the resolution plan. Oaktree and Torrent have requested to extend the deadline from November 28 to December 16. Piramal and Zurich have asked for the deadline to be pushed back to December 23.

178.title: Principal found sleeping in classroom after allegedly getting drunk in Maharashtra
178.article_body: A school principal was found sleeping inside a classroom after allegedly getting drunk in Maharashtra's Amravati. A video showing the principal sleeping on the floor of the classroom wearing a vest has surfaced online. Several social media users called for action against the principal.

179.title: Indian banks outstanding, international banks terribly run: Nikhil Kamath
179.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath on Tuesday thanked PMO, Reserve Bank of India and Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani for creating the current banking ecosystem. "Indian banks are outstanding, can't believe how terribly run international banks are," Kamath tweeted. Kamath added, "How in today's day and age can it take days to do a simple bank transfer, and cost so much?"

180.title: Students in Bengal clash over saffron scarves, hijab; school postpones exams
180.article_body: A clash broke out between two groups of students in Sankrail in West Bengal's Howrah on Tuesday after a group of five students demanded they be allowed to enter while wearing saffron scarves. The students made the demand in response to authorities' permission to allow girls to wear hijab. The authorities later cancelled scheduled exams in the school, including pre-boards.

181.title: Air India facing pilot, crew shortage amid international expansion: Report
181.article_body: Air India is facing a severe crunch in trained and experienced pilots to cater to its international expansion drive, CNBC-TV18 reported. The report added that Air India needs around 200 senior pilots to operate the recently announced 20 new weekly flights for Birmingham, London and San Francisco. The airline requires around 900-1,000 additional crew to operate on the new flights.

182.title: Adani Group in talks to raise $5 bn as banks urge to reduce debt: Report
182.article_body: The Adani Group is planning to raise roughly $5 billion after lenders asked the group to reduce leverage, Bloomberg reported citing people familiar with the matter. The group has reached out to firms including Mubadala Investment Company and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority about investments. The fundraising would include the funds raised in the potential Adani Enterprises share issue.

183.title: India to start free trade agreement negotiations with GCC on Thursday
183.article_body: India and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) will announce the launch of negotiations for a free trade agreement on Thursday, an official said. India's exports to the GCC member countries grew by 58.26% to about $44 billion in 2021-22, Commerce Ministry data showed. Notably, GCC comprises of six Gulf countries including Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Oman and Bahrain.

184.title: Which are the world's most expensive places for luxury shopping?
184.article_body: Manhattan's Upper 5th Avenue is the world's priciest street globally for luxury shopping with annual shop rents averaging $2,000 (over ₹1.6 lakh) per sq ft, according to a survey by commercial property firm Cushman & Wakefield. Hong Kong's Tsim Sha Tsui is the second-priciest, followed by Italy's Via Montenapoleone. Hong Kong's Causeway Bay had topped the ranking pre-COVID-19.

185.title: EU considers imposing price cap of $65-$70 on Russian oil: Report
185.article_body: The European Union, in coordination with the Group of Seven nations, is discussing capping the price of Russian crude oil at between $65 and $70 a barrel, Bloomberg reported. The price cap could be announced later on Wednesday after a meeting of EU ambassadors. EU has also proposed adding a number of grace periods to its cap legislation.

186.title: School timings in Haryana revised from Dec 1 over drop in temperature
186.article_body: Haryana government has announced that school timings have been revised with effect from December 1 over a drop in temperature. For schools taking classes in a single shift, the timings are 9:30 am-3:30 pm, while timings for schools taking classes in two shifts are 7:55 am-12:30 pm and 12:40 pm-5:15 pm. Timings for teachers and other staff remain unchanged.

187.title: Shraddha would’ve been alive if police had taken action, says father
187.article_body: Shraddha Walkar's father on Wednesday said that his daughter would've been alive if police had taken action against Aftab Poonawala based on the letter she had written in 2020. Shraddha submitted a written complaint to the Tulinj Police Station on November 23, 2020, alleging that Aftab had threatened to "kill her and cut her into pieces".

188.title: Nearly 100 huts, shops destroyed in fire in Assam's Karbi Anglong
188.article_body: Nearly 100 huts and shops were destroyed in a fire that broke out at Lahorijan in Assam's Karbi Anglong district near the Nagaland border on Wednesday, officials said. No injuries were reported in the fire. Police said that several cylinders burst in the fire, adding that one four-wheeler and three motorcycles were also damaged during the incident.

189.title: CBI sentences 10 people to imprisonment for bank fraud in 2013 in Hyd
189.article_body: The Special Judge for Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) cases in Hyderabad sentenced 10 people to various periods of rigorous imprisonment for involvement in bank fraud in 2013. In March 2013, the CBI registered a case against the accused for bank fraud and causing losses of over ₹4 crore to Bank of Maharashtra. A fine was also imposed on them.

190.title: Satyendar Jain to get food as per his religious beliefs in jail, says Delhi court
190.article_body: Approving AAP leader Satyendar Jain's request for "proper food", a Delhi court ordered Tihar administration to provide him with food as per his religious beliefs. Jain had complained that he was deprived of proper food in jail. As per Jain's lawyer, he eats food only after going to temple and has been eating only fruits ever since he was jailed.

191.title: Law & order in Raj has deteriorated under Ashok Gehlot regime: Thakur
191.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised the Congress government in Rajasthan and alleged that the state has witnessed a deterioration in law and order under the Ashok Gehlot regime. Speaking to reporters in Jaipur, he said, "Everyday, some or the other news is coming from Rajasthan, be it about crimes against women or atrocities against...Dalits."

192.title: Cricketers openly doing politics, says AAP on Rivaba using Jadeja's pic
192.article_body: Responding to BJP candidate Rivaba Jadeja using her husband and Indian cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's image in her campaign posters, AAP MLA Naresh Balyan said that cricketers are now "openly doing politics". Congress candidate and Ravindra Jadeja's sister, Naynaba Jadeja, accused Rivaba of using children to gain sympathy. "In a way, it is called child labour," she said.

193.title: UK Supreme Court rules against Scottish independence vote
193.article_body: The UK Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that Scotland does not have the power to conduct a fresh referendum on independence without the British government's assent. This is a setback for the semi-autonomous Scottish government, which wanted to hold an independence referendum next year. The British government has so far refused to approve the referendum plan.

194.title: Guv Koshyari wants to leave Maha: Ajit Pawar amid Shivaji remark row
194.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar has claimed that Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari had expressed his desire to leave the state and be relieved from his post. "I...asked [Koshyari] to convey this to his seniors so that they consider his wish," he added. Pawar's remarks come after Koshyari's recent remark where he called Shivaji Maharaj an "icon of olden times".

195.title: 'Tantrik' pours 50 tubes of superglue on naked couple in Rajasthan forest, kills them
195.article_body: A 'tantrik' was arrested in Udaipur for killing a couple known to him after pouring 50 superglue tubes on their naked bodies in a forest. The victims, who were married to other people, were having an affair. The 'tantrik' told the man's wife about it. When the two found out, they conspired to defame him, after which he murdered them.

196.title: Sridevi's mom asked for ₹10 lakh for film, I said I'll pay ₹11 lakh: Boney
196.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor recalled an incident where his wife Sridevi's mother had asked for ₹10 lakh fee on behalf of the late actress for a film. "I said I'll pay ₹11 lakh...I put a condition that the next film [Sridevi] signs, cannot be less than ₹15 lakh," the producer stated. He added that Sridevi was paid ₹15 lakh for 'Chandni'.

197.title: 30-year-old bike rider dies after getting hit by DJB truck
197.article_body: A 30-year-old motorbike-borne died after being hit by a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) truck in the Mangolpuri area, police said. According to reports, the truck, which is believed to be involved in the accident, was intercepted, but the accused escaped from the spot. CCTV footage is being scanned to establish the sequence of events, said a senior police official.

198.title: Brazilian influencer gets Elon Musk's name tattooed on forehead; pics surface
198.article_body: A Brazilian influencer named Rodrigo America, who considers the world's richest man Elon Musk his idol, has got the entrepreneur's name tattooed on his forehead. "What he's doing, what he's going to do, taking human beings to Mars, his name will go down in history," Rodrigo said about Musk. Rodrigo also has a rocket tattooed on his forehead.

199.title: After 16 years, CHB teachers get hike from ₹60 to ₹150 per hr in Maha
199.article_body: After 16 years, the Maharashtra government has increased the remuneration of clock-hour basis (CHB) teachers employed at higher secondary private schools from ₹60 per hour to ₹150 per hour. Meanwhile, CHB teachers of secondary private schools will now get ₹120 per hour. Unhappy with the hike, a teacher said, "With such meagre remuneration, it's very difficult to sustain in [Pune]."

200.title: Price of certain liquor to go up in Kerala as cabinet approves 4% increase in GST
200.article_body: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) in Kerala will become costlier as the state cabinet on Wednesday approved a 4% increase in general sales tax (GST). Earlier in June, the state government had hinted at the possibility of a rise in IMFL rates after cost of raw materials increased. The liquor manufacturers have also been urging the government to increase the prices.

201.title: Kyiv residents to experience 'worst winter since WWII': Mayor
201.article_body: Kyiv's Mayor Vitali Klitschko said the 3 million inhabitants of the Ukrainian capital are set to experience one of the toughest winters in recent times due to Russian shelling on the city's infrastructure. "This is the worst winter since World War II," German newspaper Bild quoted Klitschko as saying. In the "worst case scenario", residents may be evacuated, he said.

202.title: Ex-superintendent of Pune orphanage jailed over allowing child marriage
202.article_body: A local court in Maharashtra has sentenced the ex-superintendent of a government-run orphanage in Pune's Baramati to one month in jail and levied a fine of ₹52,000 on her over a child marriage held there in 2014. Lata Vasantrao Rathod was found guilty under Section 11(1) of the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act and Section 506 (criminal intimidation) of IPC.

203.title: Search efforts continue after Indonesian quake, toll rises to 268
203.article_body: Over 12,000 Indonesian Army personnel were deployed on Wednesday to expedite search operations following the deadly earthquake that struck the country's main island of Java on Monday. Chief of National Disaster Mitigation Agency Suharyanto said so far 268 bodies have been recovered and at least 151 people are still missing. Nearly 600 people are receiving treatment for serious injuries.

204.title: Even Lalit Pandit's kids don't talk to me: Jatin Pandit
204.article_body: Music composer Jatin Pandit, speaking about his equation with his brother and music composer Lalit Pandit, has said that Lalit's children also don't talk to him. "I have told this 100 times. I am always ready. But it has to happen from both sides. But I have stopped saying anymore because I was refused so many times," he added.

205.title: 5.9-magnitude quake hits northwest Turkey, no major damage reported
205.article_body: An earthquake of 5.9 magnitude struck Duzce province in northwestern Turkey on Wednesday morning, said the country's Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency. No death or major damage was reported. The quake was followed by 35 aftershocks. Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said at least 50 people were hospitalised with injuries. One of the injured is in critical condition.

206.title: Fawad Khan's Legend of Maula Jatt earns PKR 200 cr worldwide: Report
206.article_body: Pakistani film 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' has reportedly earned around PKR 200 crore worldwide. As per reports, the film collected PKR 80 crore domestically and PKR 120 crore from the overseas market. The film has also become the highest-earning Pakistani film to date. 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' featured Fawad Khan and Mahira Khan.

207.title: Drinking even less alcohol during pregnancy alters baby’s brain: Study
207.article_body: Drinking even less amount of alcohol during pregnancy can alter baby's brain structure and development, a new study stated. Researchers found that the right superior temporal sulcus (STS), a brain region involved in social cognition, audiovisual integration and language perception in the foetus exposed to alcohol, was shallower. STS has a great influence on language development during childhood.

208.title: Mangaluru blast case to be formally handed over to NIA: K'taka DGP
208.article_body: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood on Wednesday said the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case will be formally handed over to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) soon. Sood, along with Home Minister Araga Jnanendra, inspected the blast spot on the outskirts of Mangaluru and later held a meeting. Jnanendra said the accused had visited different places like Coimbatore and Kanniyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

209.title: 16-yr-old girl mowed down by bus after falling from scooter in Bengaluru
209.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was mowed down by a BMTC bus in Bengaluru after getting knocked off her mother's scooter on Tuesday. The bus reportedly swerved to the right and knocked down their scooter, following which the victim, Layashri, her brother, Yashwin, and their mother, Priyadarshini, fell to the side. Layashri and Yashwin were on their way to their school.

210.title: Russia declared a state sponsor of terrorism by European Parliament
210.article_body: The European Parliament on Wednesday designated Russia as a state sponsor of terrorism. It argued that Moscow's military strikes on civilian targets such as energy infrastructure, hospitals, schools and shelters violated international law. The move is largely symbolic, as the European Union does not have a legal framework in place to back it up.

211.title: Am I doing hawala business: T'gana Minister Malla Reddy after IT raids
211.article_body: A day after the Income Tax department conducted raids at the properties belonging to Telangana Labour Minister Malla Reddy and his son-in-law in Secunderabad, the Minister accused the BJP of creating terror. "Am I doing hawala business?" he asked. "BJP and Modi government are deploying IT officers to 50 different places and houses to create terror," Reddy said.

212.title: Congress model means corruption, nepotism, it has ruined Guj & India: PM Modi
212.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday accused Congress of indulging in vote bank politics and creating rifts between people of different castes and districts to be in power. "Congress model means corruption, nepotism...and casteism," he said. "This model has ruined not just Gujarat but also India. This is...why we've to try hard today to take the country ahead," he added.

213.title: Country-made bomb explodes near bus stop in Telangana's Siddipet
213.article_body: A country-made bomb exploded near the Husnabad RTC bus stand in Telangana's Siddipet on Tuesday, but no injuries were reported in the incident. According to the police, the bomb exploded around 9:45 am, when a fruit vendor ran his cart over it. Police later discovered five such bombs in the bushes near the bus stop and are investigating the case.

214.title: IMD predicts heavy rains in B'luru, other parts of Karnataka till Nov 24
214.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rainfall till November 24 in Bengaluru. Showers are also expected in Karnataka's coastal districts of Udupi, Dakshina Kannada and Uttara Kannada, along with the hilly regions of Shivamogga, Kodagu and Hassan. Bengaluru on Monday reported a minimum temperature of 13.9°C, the lowest temperature recorded in the city in November in a decade.

215.title: Dubai's 100-storey 'hypertower' to be the world's tallest residential building
215.article_body: Plans have been unveiled to build a 100-storey 'hypertower' in Dubai, which the developers claim will be the world's tallest residential building. Named 'Burj Binghatti Jacob & Co Residences', the hypertower will have diamond-shaped spires at the top to resemble a crown. The building will house a dedicated concierge team, offering services such as daycare, bodyguard, chauffeur and private chef.

216.title: It is dead: Lionel Messi on Argentina's morale after losing to Saudi Arabia
216.article_body: On being asked about the team's morale after losing to Saudi Arabia 1-2 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Argentina captain Lionel Messi said, "The truth? Dead." He added, "It is a very hard blow because we did not expect to start in this way." He further said, "We've to prepare for what is coming, we've to win."

217.title: Doesn't matter what people say: Hardik on criticism over Samson, Umran's non-selection
217.article_body: Referring to criticism over not selecting Umran Malik and Sanju Samson in the playing XI in the recently concluded T20I series against New Zealand, Hardik Pandya said, "Doesn't matter what people say." He added, "This is my team and I will pick the best side after discussing with the coach." He further stated that everyone will get their chances.

218.title: Cristiano Ronaldo fined ₹50 lakh for smashing young fan's phone
218.article_body: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has been fined £50,000 (₹50 lakh) and handed a two-match suspension by Football Association (FA) for smashing a young fan's phone following Manchester United's defeat against Everton at Goodison Park in April. Manchester United on Tuesday terminated Ronaldo's contract by mutual consent following his interview with Piers Morgan, wherein he had criticised the club.

219.title: Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast enters fifth day
219.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal's fast entered its fifth day on Wednesday. Dallewal has pledged to fast unto death till the Punjab government agrees to various demands of the farmers, including cancellation of cases against farmers for burning paddy residue. "Even if I die, I appeal to [farmers] to carry out their protests [peacefully]," he said.

220.title: BBL doesn't have enough money to buy Suryakumar Yadav: Glenn Maxwell
220.article_body: Praising world number one T20I batter Suryakumar Yadav, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said, "He is frustratingly consistent. Yadav is so much better than everyone else." He added, "[BBL] doesn't have enough money...to buy Suryakumar Yadav. Cricket Australia will have to sack every player, even the centrally contracted ones to gather the money and hope that he agrees [to play BBL]."

221.title: No scene happened: Dalip on Jaya Prada slapping him during rape scene
221.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil has said that he still reads reports about him getting slapped by actress Jaya Prada after he lost control during a rape scene. Refuting such reports, he stated, "Let me clarify...I have never shared screen space with Jaya Prada ji. I was keen to do so but never got the chance. No such scene ever happened."

222.title: It hurts when good music doesn't work with audience: Amit Trivedi
222.article_body: Music composer Amit Trivedi said that he was "hurt" and "depressed" when audience rejected the music of 'Bombay Velvet', 'Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana' and other films. "They were so good. I thought they'd work. But people didn't understand," he shared. The musician expressed that he has accepted and understood that audience's reaction to his music isn't in his control.

223.title: Bengaluru-based tech companies raised record $7.5 bn in 2022: Report
223.article_body: Bengaluru-based tech companies have raised a record $7.5 billion in venture capital funding in the first three quarters of 2022, according to a report from London & Partners in partnership with Dealroom. Bengaluru features among the top 10 cities globally for most investments in last five years. Bengaluru is attracting more investments than Singapore, Paris and Berlin, the report mentioned.

224.title: Want to know if there was 'hanky panky': SC to govt on EC Arun Goel's appointment
224.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the Centre on Wednesday to produce before it the file related to the appointment of Election Commissioner Arun Goel. A five-judge Constitution bench said it wants to know whether there was any "hanky panky" in Goel's appointment as Election Commissioner. The court raised questions as Goel was recently given retirement from service.

225.title: Wasn't giving me the joy I wanted: Parvathy on not doing Hindi films
225.article_body: Actress Parvathy Thiruvothu said that after 'Qarib Qarib Singlle', Bollywood offered her same sort of roles. "It wasn't giving me the joy that I wanted," she said, adding that the Malayalam film industry was giving her different characters, concepts and genres. However, she said she'd soon announce a Hindi project in which she'd be seen in a supporting role.

226.title: Musk names South Korea among top options for EV factory in Asia
226.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that South Korea is among its top candidate locations to build an electric vehicles (EVs) factory in Asia, South Korean presidential office said. During a video call with President Yoon Suk Yeol, Musk said he would make the decision on EVs factory after reviewing investment conditions in other countries, including labour, technology and infrastructure.

227.title: Dutch investor Prosus values its 9.67% Byju's stake at $578 mn
227.article_body: Netherlands-based investor Prosus valued its 9.67% stake in Byju's at $578 million by the end of the September quarter. The private investor also valued Byju's at $5.97 billion and identified the edtech unicorn as a non-controlling financial investment. In its 2022 annual report, Prosus said that it had invested a total of $536 million in Byju's.

228.title: Satyendar Jain claims video of eating food in Tihar jail is doctored
228.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's lawyers have claimed that the latest leaked video, which shows the AAP leader eating food inside his cell at Tihar jail, was based on doctored clips. Jain's lawyers told the court that the leaked video was from September and comprised tapes from different dates. The ED had the video, said Advocate Abhijit Shankar, representing Tihar jail.

229.title: Mumbai man sheds 10 kg in 2 months to donate part of liver to son
229.article_body: A Mumbai man, who weighed 86 kg, lost 10 kg in two months to donate part of his liver to his two-year-old son. After working out and following a strict diet plan, Yogesh Vaze got ready for the surgery. His son, born with a rare condition called Progressive Familial Intrahepatic Cholestasis Type 2, underwent a successful liver transplant in October.

230.title: He's a petty troll: Cong leader on Assam CM calling Rahul 'Saddam Hussein'
230.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari, on Wednesday, said that Assam CM, who called Rahul Gandhi "Saddam Hussein", sounded like a "cheap troll". "In public life, it is very important that we maintain the decorum of language and propriety," Tewari said. Citing the Morbi bridge collapse as an example, Tewari said that BJP has become "arrogant".

231.title: Received 55,497 user data requests from India in 1st half of 2022: Meta
231.article_body: Meta said that it received 55,497 requests from India to provide user data in the first half of 2022, second to the US which asked for similar information. Meta also said that it restricted access in India to 597 items in response to directions from the IT Ministry. Notably, India made 50,382 such requests in the second half of 2021.

232.title: Being associated with Dharma made me easy target to hate: Janhvi
232.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has agreed that being associated with Karan Johar and Dharma Productions has made her an "easy target to hate". The actress made her Bollywood debut with 'Dhadak', which was co-produced by Karan Johar. Talking about it, Janhvi said she doesn't regret being launched by the filmmaker but feels "unbelievably lucky and privileged".

233.title: Meaningless cricket played meaninglessly: Harmison on Eng's 0-3 series loss
233.article_body: Reacting to England's 0-3 whitewash in the recently concluded ODI series against Australia, ex-England pacer Steve Harmison said, "It was meaningless cricket played in a meaningless way." Sharing his opinion on the whitewash, ex-England wicketkeeper Matt Prior stated, "It was an absolute pumping. There was only one team that turned up all series. It was all a little bit inevitable."

234.title: Lightrock acquires majority stake in Sukoon Healthcare for $15 million
234.article_body: Lightrock India has made an investment of $15 million and acquired a significant stake in Sukoon Healthcare, a Gurugram-based psychiatric inpatient unit. Saleem Asaria, a partner at Lightrock India, will assume executive chairman's role, while founders Vidit Bahri and Kanishk Gupta will assume senior leadership roles. Sukoon plans to scale to multiple locations and expand specialist services.

235.title: World's most expensive drug approved to treat hemophilia at $3.5 million a dose
235.article_body: US regulators approved CSL Behring's hemophilia B gene therapy, a one-off infusion that costs $3.5 million a dose, making it the most expensive medicine in the world. Hemophilia B is a genetic bleeding disorder. Hemgenix works by delivering a gene that can produce the missing clotting factors into the liver, where it starts working to make the Factor IX protein.

236.title: SC to have special bench from next week to deal with tax cases: CJI
236.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud on Tuesday said that the Supreme Court will have a special bench to exclusively deal with tax cases from next week onwards. "There will be a special bench from next week onwards, on Wednesdays and Fridays, to deal with direct and indirect sales tax matters solely," CJI Chandrachud told a group of lawyers.

237.title: Married man shoots girlfriend dead in OYO hotel in Delhi, tries to kill himself
237.article_body: A 38-year-old married man named Praveen allegedly shot his girlfriend Geeta in the chest and killed her following an argument in an OYO hotel in Delhi. He also tried to kill himself by shooting in the head, however, he survived and is hospitalised. According to reports, Praveen was arrested in another murder case earlier and is currently out on bail.

238.title: Mumbai man cuts b'day cake at crematorium, hosts biryani party to bust myth
238.article_body: A man from Mumbai's Kalyan reportedly celebrated his 44th birthday at a crematorium to bust myths associated with such places. Gautam More not only cut his birthday cake there but also hosted a biryani party for family and friends at Kalyan's Mohane crematorium. More is a member of Maharashtra Andhashraddha Nirmoolan Samiti. He runs campaigns to create awareness against superstitions.

239.title: Hyd Police invoke PD Act against woman involved in human trafficking
239.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Tuesday invoked Preventive Detention (PD) Act against a woman, Nusrath Begum, who was allegedly involved in human trafficking. In 2022, Nusrath was involved in two cases of human trafficking for the sake of prostitution, police stated. Nusrath was arrested in May for allegedly kidnapping and forcing a minor into prostitution and was also arrested in October.

240.title: 4 women kidnap man on pretext of asking address, rape him in car in Punjab
240.article_body: Four women aged between 22 and 23 kidnapped a man on the pretext of asking for an address and raped him by taking turns in a car in Punjab's Jalandhar, reports said. The victim said the women made him unconscious and abducted him when he was showing them the address. He was later left on the road by the women.

241.title: Karnataka man arrested for 'purifying' tank after Dalit woman drank water
241.article_body: A 62-year-old man was arrested in Karnataka's Chamarajanagar district for allegedly draining out water from a public tank and "purifying" it with cow urine after a Dalit woman drank water from it. The woman visited Heggotara for a wedding and drank water from the tank after having lunch. The villagers allegedly abused the woman and decided to purify the tank.

242.title: IIT-Bombay submits report to BMC on Gokhale bridge, suggests minor repairs
242.article_body: IIT-Bombay on Tuesday submitted its report to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Gokhale Bridge in Andheri, which has been shut for both vehicular and pedestrian movement since November 7. According to a BMC official, experts from IIT said the bridge can be opened for two and three-wheelers in the middle portion if some minor corrections are made below the bridge.

243.title: Wouldn't have led SRH in 2014 had I known about the duration: Dhawan
243.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said he "wouldn't have" led SRH in IPL 2014 if he had known about the fact that he'll be leading the franchise for only half a season. "I was not performing as a batter, so probably they...felt I was under pressure," added Dhawan. "I still feel that you should be given a full season of captaincy," he stated.

244.title: Prison admin's fault, reports to political system: Kiran Bedi on Jain's videos
244.article_body: After AAP leader Satyendar Jain’s videos from Tihar jail surfaced, former IPS officer Kiran Bedi said, "It is the prison administration’s fault, it reports to the political system." Furthermore, she said, "Maybe he didn't know there are cameras everywhere in Tihar jail. Everything is being recorded. It should be checked if he is also being given a salary," she added.

245.title: UP court declares Shahjahanpur BJP MP as absconder
245.article_body: Local BJP MP Arun Kumar Sagar was declared as an absconder by a special MP/MLA court in UP’s Shahjahanpur after he failed to appear before it in connection with a case pertaining to the seizure of poll material in 2019. In 2019, the then SDM Sadar seized campaign material of Sagar on the Bareilly-Jalalabad road and a case was registered.

246.title: VI shareholders approve issuing ₹1,600-cr debentures to ATC Telecom
246.article_body: Debt-ridden Vodafone Idea's (VI) shareholders have approved issuing debentures worth ₹1,600 crore to ATC Telecom Infrastructure on a preferential basis. The due amount will be converted into equities if the amount remained unpaid for 18 months. VI is raising the amount through equity convertible debt bonds that carry a coupon rate of 11.2% per annum payable every six months.

247.title: Actor Vikram Gokhale admitted to hospital, condition critical
247.article_body: Veteran actor Vikram Gokhale was admitted to Pune's Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital a few days back. His condition remains critical, according to a tweet by ANI. Gokhale's family is yet to issue an official statement on his health. He has been a part of several Bollywood films including 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa', among others.

248.title: Shot almost half of the film blindfolded: Taapsee on 'Blurr'
248.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said that she was blindfolded for almost half of her upcoming film 'Blurr', which is also co-produced by the actress. Talking about the film, Taapsee said the film's script was an "immediate yes" for her. 'Blurr' also stars Gulshan Devaiah and is directed by Ajay Bahl. The psychological thriller will release on OTT platform on December 9.

249.title: We got exactly what we wanted: Buttler after series whitewash vs Aus
249.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said his team got "exactly" what they wanted from their recently concluded tour of Australia, having suffered a 0-3 whitewash in the ODI series. "It's just been a few games too far...Australia have outplayed us...It has...been hard. I am not fussed at all about the results, to be honest," added Buttler.

250.title: Savarkar chapter is closed: Congress' Jairam Ramesh
250.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that the "Savarkar chapter is closed". He was addressing a press conference in Madhya Pradesh. Earlier, Sanjay Raut, the spokesperson of Uddhav Thackeray’s faction of Shiv Sena, said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s remarks on Veer Savarkar will not be accepted in Maharashtra and will cause cracks in the MVA alliance.

251.title: BJP's Adhikari skips WB Guv's oath due to seating plan, calls it humiliating
251.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari refused to attend the oath-taking ceremony of incoming West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose on Wednesday. He said the placement of his seat behind TMC MPs during the oath-taking ceremony was done on purpose to "humiliate the Opposition". "This is a misuse of the opportunity given to her (CM Mamata Banerjee)," he said.

252.title: Foxconn confirms 'violence' at China iPhone factory as videos of clashes go viral
252.article_body: Foxconn has confirmed the overnight "violence" that took place at its iPhone factory in China. In a statement, Foxconn said the workers had complained about pay and conditions at the plant and said it will "prevent similar incidents from happening again". Several viral videos from the incident showed hundreds of workers clashing with security guards and personnel in hazmat suits.

253.title: What is the wait time for US visitor visa appointment in different Indian cities?
253.article_body: The US has listed that people applying for visitor visa in Delhi will have to wait 961 days for an appointment. The wait time for visitor visa in Mumbai is 999 days. The waiting period for visitor visa in Kolkata, Hyderabad and Chennai is 904, 994 and 948 days, respectively. The estimated wait time can change weekly, the website said.

254.title: Will end VIP darshan practice in temples: Tamil Nadu minister
254.article_body: Tamil Nadu minister PK Sekar Babu has said that the government will gradually end the practice of VIP darshan in temples in the state. He said the practice of giving VIP darshan tickets at the Anjaneyar temple in Namakkal has been stopped. "Though it generated ₹40 lakh revenue to the temple annually, we decided to scrap it," he said.

255.title: Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-manager Disha Salian's death was accidental: CBI
255.article_body: After probing Sushant Singh Rajput's former manager Disha Salian's death case, the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has concluded that she died by accident. "Salian, who had consumed alcohol, lost her balance and slipped from the parapet of her flat," a CBI official said. Disha (28) had fallen from her apartment's 14th floor in Mumbai on June 8, 2020.

256.title: Shraddha could have been saved if action was taken on her complaint in 2020: Fadnavis
256.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said he has seen the police complaint filed by Shraddha Walkar against Aftab Poonawala in 2020, adding, "Maybe she could have been saved if action was taken." He said, "I don't want to accuse anyone but if action is not taken, such incidents happen." He added it will be investigated why action was not taken.

257.title: Satyendar Jain moves Delhi court to restrain media from airing CCTV clips
257.article_body: Jailed Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain moved an application in Delhi court seeking its direction to restrain media to air or broadcast any clip of CCTV footage related to him in Tihar jail. This comes after CCTV footage of Jain getting "proper food" and massage inside jail went viral. The matter will be taken up by the Delhi court on Thursday.

258.title: Asia's largest US consulate set to open in Hyd in January 2023
258.article_body: Asia's largest US consulate is set to open in Hyderabad's financial district in January 2023 for which the US has invested $297 million. The consulate is made on a 12.2-acre site and will have 55 visa procession windows. The US Consulate in Hyderabad first opened in 2009 and is located in Paigah Palace, Chiran Fort Lane, Begumpet.

259.title: 'Modi sarkar par bharosa mat karo, shaadi karlo', says Owaisi
259.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday used a joke to take a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over the high unemployment rate in India. "Modi sarkar par bharosa mat karo, tum shaadi karlo," Owaisi quoted a man as saying to the woman he loved, whose father was getting her married to another man because he didn't have a government job.

260.title: Simu Liu reacts to Quentin Tarantino's anti-Marvel remark
260.article_body: After Quentin Tarantino said that Marvel actors are "not movie stars", actor Simu Liu tweeted that he's proud to have worked with Marvel Studios that made efforts to improve diversity on screen. "If the only gatekeepers to movie stardom came from Tarantino and Scorsese, I would never have had the opportunity to lead a $400 million plus movie," he added.

261.title: Jet Airways loses accreditation for aviation security training
261.article_body: Aviation security agency Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) withdrew its accreditation of Jet Airways' security training facilities. The Jalan Kalrock consortium, who won the bid to acquire the airline, said they surrendered the accreditation voluntarily. Amid uncertainty of Jet Airways' revival, the airline said it would reduce staff salaries and send many employees on leave without pay.

262.title: Mumbai local train services to remain hit till Nov 26 due to mega block
262.article_body: The Mumbai local train services will remain affected till November 26 as Western Railway is carrying out a mega block for repair and maintenance of Heritage building at Bandra on DNLL and C/LOOP line. The railway block has been undertaken from 1:35 am on the intervening night of November 22-23 to 4:35 am on November 26.

263.title: Ensure your name on voter list to avoid detention under NRC: Mamata
263.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has urged people to ensure that their name is on voter list to avoid being sent to detention camps "in...name of National Register of Citizens (NRC)". She also mentioned incidents of land being "forcibly taken over" by railway and airport authorities, adding, "No eviction will be allowed in Bengal without proper compensation and rehabilitation."

264.title: Adani group's cash generation ability underappreciated: M&G Investments
264.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani's group hasn't been appreciated enough for its cash-flow generation ability, said Vikas Pershad, fund manager at M&G Investments. He added that Adani is incubating and operating in real businesses that generate cash such as ports, airports, rail and logistics. "[The] businesses will grow if India grows. They're at the right place at the right time," he said.

265.title: Marvel actors are not movie stars: Quentin Tarantino
265.article_body: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino said that characters of Marvel films might be popular but the actors cannot be called movie stars. He said that while he isn't against Marvel and DC movies, he has "problem" with the fact that they "are the entire representation of this era of movies" and the "only things" that seem to generate excitement among the audience.

266.title: No chance of me withdrawing from IPL, want to get every cent: Maxwell
266.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said there is no chance of him withdrawing from the IPL. "I want to cash in on every cent possible and then retire happily," added Maxwell. "I'll...work on avoiding tissue injuries that could happen as an older player," he stated. Pat Cummins is among the players who will not participate in the next edition of IPL.

267.title: EU confirms investigating TikTok over its data practices
267.article_body: The EU has confirmed that there are multiple ongoing investigations into TikTok over its data practices and targeted advertising aimed at minors. They include an investigation by Ireland about TikTok's compliance with several General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements. TikTok also faces a litigation before the Dutch courts concerning targeted advertising and data transfers to China.

268.title: Manholes are death traps, close them up in a week: Bombay HC to BMC
268.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday called open manholes 'death traps' and said people may unknowingly fall in them and hurt themselves grievously. Chief Justice Dipankar Datta and Justice Abhay Ahuja, while hearing a contempt petition filed by lawyer Ruju Thakker, gave the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) a week to close the manholes on the Eastern Express Highway.

269.title: Haryana to cancel criminal cases against farmers during farm laws agitation
269.article_body: The Haryana government has decided to withdraw criminal cases registered against farmers, barring heinous crimes, during their 2020-21 agitation against the now-scrapped farm laws. Also, no action will be taken against government employees who supported the agitation. Following this, the Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU), Charuni, has called off Delhi-Chandigarh highway blockade scheduled on Thursday.

270.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released; Kohli, Rohit, Rahul slip
270.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul dropping spots. Virat Kohli is now ranked 13th, while KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma are ranked 19th and 21st, respectively. Suryakumar Yadav continues to be on top of the rankings and has a 54-rating point lead over second-placed Muhammad Rizwan.

271.title: Train operator prevents woman's suicide bid on Navi Mumbai railway track
271.article_body: A 54-year-old on-duty operator of a suburban train saved an 18-year-old woman who was lying on a railway track in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. Prashant Konnur prevented the train from hitting the woman by applying emergency brakes on time. The woman had allegedly attempted suicide. Konnur counselled her and helped her board the women's compartment of the train.

272.title: Hyderabad teacher sentenced to 10 yrs in jail for molesting minor boy
272.article_body: A 49-year-old private teacher in Hyderabad, Ravindran Prakash, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for molesting a minor boy. In 2018, Saroornagar Police received a complaint from the boy's father alleging that the accused sexually assaulted him while he was on his way to attend tuition. The POCSO Court imposed a fine of ₹45,000 on Prakash, a repeat offender.

273.title: Pune man kidnapped, beaten to death over cricket betting; 2 bookies arrested
273.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Pune was allegedly kidnapped and beaten to death over cricket betting last week. Police have arrested two bookies in connection with the case. According to police, the deceased owed money to the bookies, who were threatening him and demanding money before his abduction. The man ran a construction business in the past but was currently unemployed.

274.title: Russia has nearly exhausted current stock of Iran-made weapons: UK
274.article_body: Britain's Defence Ministry has said that it is likely that Russia has nearly exhausted its current stock of Iran-made weapons and will seek to restock. Russia has likely launched a number of Iranian manufactured un-crewed aerial vehicles against Ukraine since September, the statement added. Iran and Russia have reportedly reached a deal to start production of attack drones in Russia.

275.title: New Zealand hikes interest rate to 4.25%, the highest since 2009
275.article_body: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand increased interest rate by a record 75 basis points to 4.25%,  the highest since early 2009. The central bank warned of an entire year in recession to rein in inflation. This is the first time the bank has raised rate by more than a half-point since the Official Cash Rate was introduced in 1999.

276.title: ICC releases all-time T20I batting rankings, Suryakumar just 2 points behind Kohli
276.article_body: The ICC today released the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav breaking into the top five. Suryakumar achieved his career-best 895 rating points on November 20 and is now placed fifth on the all-time rankings. He is just two rating points behind third-ranked Virat Kohli, who had achieved his career-best 897 rating points on September 7, 2014.

277.title: False: Musk on reports of FTX Founder owning a $100 million stake in Twitter
277.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk has denied reports of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's Founder and former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried owning a $100 million stake in Twitter. Responding to a tweet by a news website regarding the same, Musk responded, "False". Earlier, several message exchanges between Musk and Sam regarding the Twitter takeover had surfaced online.

278.title: Manoj Tiwari to become a father again at 51; shares celebration video
278.article_body: Actor-politician Manoj Tiwari is set to become a father for the third time at 51. He took to social media to share a video from his wife's baby shower and wrote, "Some happiness cannot be described in words...it can just be felt." The couple already have a daughter together and Manoj Tiwari also has a daughter from his ex-wife.

279.title: India & BJP have become synonymous: Gajendra Shekhawat in Gujarat
279.article_body: Campaigning for Gujarat elections, Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Shekhawat on Tuesday said that India and BJP have become synonymous. Claiming that the Congress party divided Gujarat on caste basis, Shekhawat at a rally in Gandhinagar said, "There was a time when our Gujarat, especially Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar were known as cities of riots."

280.title: Colorado gay nightclub shooting suspect who killed 5 is non-binary: Court filing
280.article_body: The alleged shooter who killed five people at a gay nightclub in US state of Colorado is non-binary and uses they/them pronouns, his legal team said. It has also been revealed that the 22-year-old shooter, Anderson Lee Aldrich, was known as Nicholas Franklin Brink until 2016. The suspect's father is a pornography performer with an extensive criminal history, records show.

281.title: Leopard spotted on IIT-Bombay campus; forest officials alerted
281.article_body: A distress call was made to the forest department on Monday morning after a leopard was allegedly spotted on the campus of IIT-Bombay. A forest official said, "Our teams are initiating all necessary actions." Leopards, which are generally nocturnal, can be spotted in the area in day too as the campus lies near the Sanjay Gandhi National Park, he added.

282.title: Wait time for US visitor visa reaches nearly 1,000 days in Delhi
282.article_body: The appointment waiting time for applicants of B-1 and B-2 visitor visas for the US has reached 961 days in Delhi, according to US State Department website. "The estimated wait time to receive...interview appointment...can change weekly and is based on actual incoming workload and staffing," it said. "These are estimates only and do not guarantee...availability of...appointment," the website read.

283.title: He can go to any level: Cong leader on Assam CM's 'Saddam Hussein' remark
283.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s "Saddam Hussein" remark for Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress’ Bhupen Kumar Borah said Sarma can go to any level for power. "You just want a headline and you get that only when you take Rahul Gandhi’s name. Himanta Biswa Sarma can say anything," he added. "We don’t pay attention," Borah stated.

284.title: India repatriates Pakistani national after he serves 10 years in jail
284.article_body: A Pakistani national, who had entered India illegally, was repatriated through the Attari-Wagah border on Tuesday after he served his 10-year-long jail term, an official confirmed. Kala Massi had allegedly entered India without a passport and visa in 2011 and was apprehended in Punjab's Majitha, where a pistol and cartridge were recovered from him. Massi hails from Pakistan's Narowal.

285.title: Ready to re-launch Jet Airways within 60-90 days of ownership transfer: CEO
285.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor on Wednesday said that they are ready to re-launch within 60-90 days of the transfer of ownership. "There is no standoff between the lenders and the consortium. Both parties are working together for the implementation of the approved resolution plan," Kapoor added. Last week, Jet Airways reduced the salaries of nearly 33% of the employees.

286.title: Give us our pay: Shout workers as men smash cameras at China iPhone plant
286.article_body: People smashed surveillance cameras and windows at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Foxconn in China's Zhengzhou as the workers shouted, "Give us our pay!" Videos of the incident showed workers protesting and they were surrounded by people in full hazmat suits, some carrying batons. The protest reportedly started over unpaid wages and fear of spreading infection.

287.title: Didn't know what sexual harassment was before Bombshell: Margot Robbie
287.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie has said that she did not know the definition of sexual harassment before she worked in the 2019 film 'Bombshell'. "I always thought [sexual harassment] required physical contact for it to be considered illegal or wrong," Margot added. She stated that she was shocked to know that "any unwelcome sexual advances" was included in sexual harassment.

288.title: Rumours about new traffic fines in Hyderabad fake: Police
288.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have asked citizens not to believe in any rumours about "new traffic fines" in the city warning that those who are found spreading the fake information will be prosecuted as per law. The police further said that the fines against traffic violations are in accordance with 2011 guidelines issued in the erstwhile combined state of Andhra Pradesh.

289.title: B'luru man kills friend over money, goes to police with body in car
289.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for killing his friend in Bengaluru and taking his body to a police station in a car. According to the police, the deceased had taken over ₹2 crore from the accused's mother and some of her friends after promising to get her a loan at subsidised interest but refused to return the money.

290.title: Ex-US President Trump loses legal bid to prevent release of tax returns
290.article_body: The US Supreme Court has rejected former US President Donald Trump's emergency application which sought to prevent the Treasury Department from releasing his six years of tax returns to a congressional committee. The Democrat-controlled Ways and Means Committee, has been seeking Trump's tax returns since 2019. Trump's lawyers argued that the committee lacks legal basis for requesting tax returns.

291.title: 2 traffic violators beat up woman police & her colleagues in Pune; arrested
291.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested two persons for allegedly beating up an on-duty woman traffic police and her colleagues at Dehu Phata chowk. The accused, Bhushan Jain and Dattatraya Kokare, allegedly manhandled and sexually molested the female police when she asked them to not use a closed road. When her colleagues tried to intervene, they also allegedly threw punches at them.

292.title: PMC to undertake beautification work ahead of G20 summit meetings in city
292.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has commenced preparations ahead of next year's G20 summit by undertaking road repair work in parts of the city where delegates may visit. "The civic administration has received 43 proposals for beautification of junctions and so far approved work for...12 junctions," an official said. Notably, a few summit meetings will also be held in Mumbai.

293.title: Car catches fire in Thane, no casualties reported
293.article_body: A Honda Mobility car at Hiranandani Meadows in Thane reportedly caught fire on Tuesday night. While the car was damaged, no casualties were reported in the incident. Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant said their team, along with fire brigade personnel and one fire vehicle, reached the spot and doused the fire within an hour.

294.title: Fake educational certificate racket busted in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
294.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested three people for selling fake educational certificates from various universities and supporting and VISA documents to needy students at the price of ₹50,000-₹60,000. According to police, the main accused used to run a flex designing unit. Among the other two accused, one used to work in an educational consultancy and other as a visa processing counsellor.

295.title: Shraddha's murder was well-planned & not heat of moment act, says expert
295.article_body: Apollo hospital's Senior Consultant Psychiatrist, Dr Sandeep Vohra, on Tuesday said that Shraddha's murder was a well-planned move and not an act that could've happened in the heat of the moment. He said that the way Aftab acted after killing Shraddha can only be done by someone who has psychopathic traits, adding that the accused has no remorse.

296.title: Meghalaya villagers burn down forest office in Assam district
296.article_body: A group of villagers from Meghalaya burned down a forest office in Assam's West Karbi Anglong district, said officials. The incident occurred soon after six people died in firing during a clash between Assam Police and Meghalaya villagers at the interstate border. Villagers, carrying machetes, rods and sticks, torched furniture, documents and motorcycles parked in the complex, officials added.

297.title: Satyendar Jain enjoying resort-like facilities in Tihar jail: Lekhi
297.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain is enjoying facilities similar to a holiday resort inside Tihar jail, Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said. Her statement came after a new CCTV footage from Tihar jail showed Jain getting "proper food" in jail. "There's food being served on a platter, masseur facility is available, it isn't a luxury resort," Lekhi stated.

298.title: UP CM Yogi launches 755 projects worth ₹878 crore in Ghaziabad
298.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for 755 projects worth a total of about ₹878 crore in Ghaziabad on Tuesday. During the event, Adityanath said that before 2017, the city was among the "dirtiest and no investments came here", however, now it has an expressway and "the country's first rapid train will also commence here".

299.title: SpaceX launches Eutelsat 10B mission from Florida's Cape Canaveral
299.article_body: SpaceX on Tuesday launched Eutelsat 10B communications satellite from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. The satellite, launched using a Falcon 9 rocket, will provide internet service to air and sea traffic. The Elon Musk-led space company on Monday said weather was 20% favourable and delayed the launch to allow for additional pre-flight checkouts.

300.title: Musk finds closet full of '#StayWoke' t-shirts at Twitter headquarters
300.article_body: Elon Musk found a closet full of t-shirts with '#StayWoke' written on them at Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco and shared a video of the closet on Twitter. Twitter's former CEO Jack Dorsey popularised the t-shirts following the killing of 18-year-old Michael Brown in the US. It was a call for awareness against the alleged police violence against Black people.

301.title: Karnataka court stays distribution, sale of book on Tipu Sultan
301.article_body: A court in Karnataka stayed the distribution and sale of a book on Tipu Sultan, titled 'Tipu Nija Kanasugalu' (Real Dreams of Tipu). This comes after former Chairman of the District Wakf Board Committee, BS Rafiulla, filed a suit contending the book contains incorrect information on Tipu Sultan and that it could cause unrest and communal disharmony.

302.title: Man beaten to death over non-payment of debt in Pune; 2 arrested
302.article_body: Two repeat offenders were arrested after a 32-year-old man was beaten to death over non-payment of debt in Pune, officials said on Tuesday. The deceased had borrowed ₹28,000 from one of the accused, according to officials. The deceased's wife claimed that the accused had called her husband for a meeting in Bibwewadi earlier this month, then kidnapped and killed him.

303.title: Delhivery stock falls by 5.3% to 52-week low after large trade report
303.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by 5.3% to a 52-week low of ₹317/piece after reports of a large trade. Delhivery shares were trading with cuts in the sixth straight trading session. Bloomberg data showed at least 12.8 lakh shares changed hands in large trade. At 1:47 pm, the company's stock was trading 4.42% lower at ₹320.10/share on the NSE.

304.title: 1 dead in twin blasts in Jerusalem, police says 'Haven't seen such attack in years'
304.article_body: Two explosions at bus stops on Jerusalem's outskirts killed one and wounded up to 15 people on Wednesday, emergency services said. The Israeli police said it appeared to be an attack by Palestinian militants. Israel's police chief Kobi Shabtai said, "We haven't seen such an attack in years," adding that police are searching for more possible explosives in the city.

305.title: Mumbai local train services disrupted after commuter gets hit by train
305.article_body: Mumbai's suburban local train services were acutely disrupted on Wednesday morning due to a case of trespassing between Borivali and Kandivali. Nearly three-four trains were affected after a person was hit by train, according to the Western Railway officials. The person who was hit has been taken to a nearby hospital, the officials added.

306.title: German Catholic Church amends law to allow LGBTQ employees to work
306.article_body: The Catholic Church in Germany has amended its law stating that all employees can be representatives of a church that serves people, independent of their sexual identity. The amendment comes after 125 employees of the Catholic Church came out as queer in a demonstration. Earlier, Catholic Church employees could lose their jobs for being open about having a same-sex partner.

307.title: It's hard to watch him bat, embarrassing: Maxwell on Suryakumar's 111*
307.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said Suryakumar Yadav is batting on a "completely different" planet, adding that his 111* in the second T20I against New Zealand was "hard to watch". "It's embarrassing that he's so much better than everyone else," stated Maxwell. Talking about Suryakumar potentially playing in the Big Bash League, Maxwell said, "We won't be able to afford him."

308.title: How long will CM Sangma let Assam CM take Meghalaya for granted?: TMC MP
308.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said that he was "deeply saddened" by the firing incident at the Assam-Meghalaya border that left six persons, including an Assam forest official, dead. Adding that the incident showed the Meghalaya government's "ineptitude", he further said, "For how long will CM Conrad Sangma allow [Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma] to take Meghalaya for granted?"

309.title: Accepted small roles for survival, had no alternative: Nawazuddin
309.article_body: While revisiting his journey in Bollywood, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui revealed that he accepted small roles to survive in the film industry. "I had no other alternative," he said, adding that it is the "difficult time that makes you strong". He shared that before becoming an actor, he worked as a chemist in a petrochemical company for a short while.

310.title: The fire has spread in the jungle: Kaif on Shreyas' golden duck vs NZ
310.article_body: Discussing Shreyas Iyer's dismissal for a golden duck in India's third T20I against New Zealand, Mohammad Kaif said, "The fire has spread in the jungle, everyone knows how Shreyas plays against the short ball." "Hard length, short ball, a slip was placed. Every bowler bowls...[bouncers to] Shreyas," added Kaif. Shreyas scored 13 runs in the T20I series against New Zealand.

311.title: 2 men molest female constable in Pune after being stopped at no-vehicle zone
311.article_body: A female traffic constable was allegedly molested and pushed to ground in Pune while her male colleague was attacked by two men whom she stopped after they tried to force their way into a no-vehicle zone created for a pilgrimage in Alandi, police said. They were arrested. One of them allegedly grabbed her by the chest and pushed her hard.

312.title: Who was ex-poll body chief TN Seshan for whom SC said 'Seshan happens once in a while'?
312.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday praised former Chief Election Commissioner TN Seshan, saying, "Seshan happens once in a while". Seshan is credited for major electoral reforms as he introduced a list of 150 malpractices during elections, including liquor distribution, bribing, use of religion in speeches. He introduced voter ID cards, Model Code of Conduct, and enforced a limit to poll expenses.

313.title: Actress Aindrila Sharma's boyfriend kisses her feet at her funeral
313.article_body: The boyfriend of actress Aindrila Sharma, who passed away on Sunday in Kolkata, was seen kneeling before her body and kissing her feet at her funeral. Videos on social media also showed Sabyasachi Chowdhury performing the last rites with Aindrila's father. Sabyasachi appears to have deleted his social media accounts following Aindrila's demise.

314.title: Musk blocked Twitter staff's corporate cards, refused to reimburse travel bills: Report
314.article_body: After taking over Twitter, Elon Musk blocked employees' corporate credit cards, a report by The New York Times said. Musk reportedly refused to reimburse travel invoices of current and former employees, while his staff said that the services were authorised by the company’s former management and not him. His staff is said to have been avoiding calls from travel vendors.

315.title: Meesho joins ONDC to support inclusive e-commerce ecosystem
315.article_body: Bengaluru-based online retailer Meesho announced its integration with the government's Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). The pilot will be launched in Bengaluru and gradually rolled out in other locations over the coming months, it said. The move will help connect buyers with hyperlocal sellers and support India's vision of creating an inclusive e-commerce ecosystem, the startup said.

316.title: Hyderabad police constable saves electrocuted man by giving CPR
316.article_body: A police constable of Banjara Hill Traffic Police Station in Hyderabad performed Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) to save a man who suffered an electric shock on Tuesday evening. This incident took place near GVK House’s main gate. After administering CPR, the police constable, A Shankar, called an ambulance and took the man to a nearby hospital.

317.title: I was obsessed with my body & weight at 17: Alia Bhatt
317.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that at the age of 17, she was obsessed with her body and her weight. She admitted that the obsession “took a toll” on her. The actress further shared that during her pregnancy, she felt “comfortable”, “happy and more at peace” with her body. Alia recently welcomed her first child, a baby girl.

318.title: 35 illegal structures on Pune's Navale bridge service roads razed
318.article_body: At least 35 illegal constructions have been demolished by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on service roads along the Navale bridge on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Pune, the police said. The step was taken after a truck had hit several vehicles on Sunday and caused a pile-up on the highway leaving several people injured.

319.title: Son hospitalised after CRPF beat him, not allowed to see him: Malla Reddy on I-T raids
319.article_body: Telangana Labour Minister Chamakura Malla Reddy has claimed that his elder son has been hospitalised after being beaten "entire night" by CRPF personnel, who accompanied Income Tax Department officials during raids at several places linked to him. "They are not allowing my son's doctor to visit him. They are not even allowing me to see him," he added.

320.title: Stop all construction work on Sukhatal near Naini Lake: HC to govt
320.article_body: The Uttarakhand High Court on Tuesday ordered the government to stop all construction activities on the bed of Sukhatal, which is less than a kilometre from Naini Lake in Nainital. This comes after a group of 104 local activists and citizens wrote to the HC Chief Justice, who took suo moto cognizance of the matter.

321.title: Working closely with law enforcement: Walmart after fatal shooting in US store
321.article_body: Several people died and many others were injured after a shooting took place at a Walmart store in Virginia on Tuesday night. Sharing a statement about the same, Walmart tweeted, "We are shocked at this tragic event at our Chesapeake, Virginia store. We're praying for those impacted...We’re working closely with law enforcement, and we are focused on supporting our associates."

322.title: Felt I could play in T20 WC 2022, not being there really hurt: Venkatesh
322.article_body: All-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said he felt "really hurt" as he wasn't able to represent India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "I don't want to put myself in a position to think about something which is really far away from me," added Venkatesh. "I would have wanted to be there, but again it is not in my hands," he stated.

323.title: Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters Madhya Pradesh
323.article_body: After a two-day break, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra resumed as it entered Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The foot march resumed from Boderli village in the Burhanpur district. Former MP CMs Kamal Nath and Digvijaya Singh joined Gandhi in the march. The party is aiming to pass through seven districts of the state over the next 11 days.

324.title: Ukraine promises shelter, electricity, internet to people as winter nears
324.article_body: Ukrainian government has promised to provide shelters with heat and water to people and encouraged them to save energy as winter approaches. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that special "invincibility centres" will be set up around the country to provide electricity, internet, mobile phone connections and a pharmacy free of cost and around the clock.

325.title: Ex-Niti Aayog VC Rajiv Kumar joins India Sotheby's advisory board
325.article_body: Former Vice Chairman of the Niti Aayog Rajiv Kumar has joined India Sotheby's International Realty's policy and advisory board. Kumar will advise the company on policy and advocacy matters with the objective of promoting transparency and professionalism in the real estate sector, India Sotheby's International Realty said. Kumar is an alumnus of St Stephen's College and Lucknow University.

326.title: 2 assault revenue officers, tear land records in GB Nagar village
326.article_body: A case has been filed after two suspects threatened, abused and assaulted revenue officers in a village in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Dadri, police said. The accused also tore land records when the revenue officers reached the village to measure land parcels. Police personnel were accompanying the revenue officers, however, they left midway due to some confusion over jurisdiction, officials said.

327.title: We will pick bowlers who can intimidate the batter: Hardik Pandya
327.article_body: Sharing his approach to captaincy, Hardik Pandya said, "For me and my bowling unit, the plan is simple - Let's be aggressive. What's...[the worst thing that can] happen? We will...lose the game or maybe they'll score 200." "Aggressive is not about going for [a] wicket off every ball. It's about your behaviour...We'll pick bowlers...who can intimidate the batter," added Hardik.

328.title: Drug addict kills parents, sister, grandmother after returning home from rehab in Delhi
328.article_body:
A drug addict killed his entire family days after returning home from a rehabilitation centre in Delhi. He stabbed his parents, sister, and grandmother to death after a fight, the police said on 
Wednesday. The neighbours who heard screams from the house caught the man as he tried to escape after murdering his family.

329.title: Jet Airways' stock falls by 15% in three days, hits new 52-week low
329.article_body: Jet Airways' stock fell by 15% in three consecutive sessions and hit a new 52-week low of ₹65.55/piece on Wednesday. Its stock dropped by 30% in November and is down by 26% in 2022 so far. With the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security withdrawing the accreditation given to its aviation security training facilities, the airline's revival plan has hit limbo.

330.title: Couple shares selfie after surviving plane crash in Peru, post goes viral
330.article_body: A selfie, clicked by a couple, who survived a plane crash at an airport in Peru has gone viral. Enrique Varsi-Rospigliosi shared the image on Twitter along with the caption, "When life gives you a second chance #latam." Two firefighters were killed when a LATAM airline passenger plane hit a firetruck during takeoff and caught fire on the runway.

331.title: TikTok may have misled Congress on data sharing with China: US lawmakers
331.article_body: Republican lawmakers have raised concerns that China-owned TikTok may have misled the US Congress on how much user data it shares with China. "Some of the information TikTok provided...appears to be untrue or misleading, including that TikTok does not track US user locations," Republican lawmakers said in a letter to TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew.

332.title: Man accused of handing out fake ID cards in B'luru data theft case arrested
332.article_body: The Bengaluru Police made its sixth arrest in the voter data theft case. Lokesh KM, the man who handed out fake ID cards that were used to conduct illegal voter surveys by NGO Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust, was arrested on  Tuesday. Lokesh was absconding after cases were registered against him and was caught from outskirts of Bengaluru.

333.title: Balenciaga issues apology after ad features kids with bondage gear
333.article_body: Balenciaga issued an apology after receiving criticism over its recent ad campaign that featured children holding teddy bears dressed in bondage gear and used a photo of a Supreme Court opinion in a child pornography case as a prop. The company said, "We sincerely apologise for any offence our holiday campaign may have caused...We've removed the campaign from all platforms."

334.title: Videos show workers at Apple's biggest factory in China clash with security personnel
334.article_body: Hundreds of workers at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Foxconn in China clashed with security personnel amid strict COVID-19 restrictions on Wednesday. Several videos of the incident showed workers marching on the road with some being confronted by a row of people in hazmat suits. The violent protest reportedly started over unpaid wages and fear of spreading infection.

335.title: He'll kill me, cut me up in pieces: Shraddha in police complaint against Aftab in 2020
335.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, who was allegedly killed by Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, had filed a police complaint against him in Vasai in 2020, alleging that he tried to kill her. She wrote, "He blackmails that he will kill me, cut me up in pieces and throw me away." She added that his parents were aware that he tried to kill her.

336.title: Journalist heckled after regional Brazilian flag mistaken as LGBTQ symbol in Qatar
336.article_body: A Brazilian journalist covering FIFA World Cup in Qatar said that local police harassed him after regional Brazilian flag was mistaken for an LGBTQ pride flag. Victor Pereira said that authorities seized his phone after he recorded a man's negative reaction to a colourful flag that represented Brazil's Pernambuco state. Pernambuco Governor Paulo Camara expressed his solidarity with Pereira.

337.title: Faridabad to have ₹200 crore waste to methanol plant by Dec 2023
337.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has identified eight acres of land in Faridabad's Sihi to set up a ₹200 crore waste-to-methanol plant by December 2023, officials said. The plant will be used to convert 500 tonnes of waste into 50 kilo-litres of methanol daily. Methanol is commonly used as a fuel, antifreeze and as solvent.

338.title: Dr CV Ananda Bose takes oath as Governor of West Bengal
338.article_body: Retired IAS officer Dr CV Ananda Bose took oath as the Governor of West Bengal in Kolkata today. Bose will be replacing La Ganesan, who was appointed as the state Governor after Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as the Vice-President of India. Earlier, Bose said that he sees Mamata Banerjee as a "respected" CM and he'll work with her with "objectivity".

339.title: Navi Mumbai man loses ₹1.59 crore in crypto investment
339.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Navi Mumbai lost ₹1.59 crore he invested in cryptocurrency on the advice of a woman he met on dating app OkCupid. The woman, who identified herself as a resident of the Philippines, told him that her family members are financial advisors. Initially, the man's $199 investment grew to $224, which convinced him to invest more.

340.title: She'll come out stronger: Shriya on Samantha's battle with myositis
340.article_body: Actress Shriya Saran wished speedy recovery for Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who recently opened up about being diagnosed with myositis. "This is a passing phase. She will come out strong," Shriya said, adding that Samantha is a "strong girl" and a "beautiful girl inside out". Shriya's latest release 'Drishyam 2', also starring Ajay Devgn, is doing well at the box office.

341.title: Temasek-backed Licious' losses surge by 130% in FY22, revenue up 64%
341.article_body: Bengaluru-based meat delivery startup Licious' losses surged by nearly 130% to ₹855 crore in FY22 year-on-year. The Temasek-backed startup's losses were driven by higher advertisement and promotional expenses, along with increasing employee benefit costs. The unicorn's revenue grew by 64% to ₹683 crore as against ₹416 crore in FY21. Its total expenses rose by 80% to ₹1,191 crore year-on-year.

342.title: Messi has to earn the right to win WC: Keane after Argentina's loss
342.article_body: Ex-Manchester United captain Roy Keane said Argentina captain Lionel Messi has to "earn the right" to win the FIFA World Cup following Argentina's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. "You can't just say that a player deserves it...Messi and his teammates [need] to give themselves a chance of winning the World Cup," added Keane.

343.title: Andhra govt sets up exclusive cell to make it 'climate resilient'
343.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has set up an exclusive Climate Change Cell (CCC) for the implementation of its action plan and to make it "climate resilient through improved climate change governance". The cell's main aim is climate change mitigation and protection of vulnerable sections through an inclusive and sustainable development strategy, according to a state special chief secretary.

344.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro challenges result of presidential election he lost to Lula
344.article_body: Outgoing Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has challenged the result of the presidential election he lost last month and demanded the election authority to annul votes cast on most of the nation's electronic voting machines. Bolsonaro, who lost the election to leftist leader Lula da Silva, blamed a software bug that caused "irreparable non-compliance due to malfunction".

345.title: Multiple people killed in shooting at Walmart store in US
345.article_body: Multiple people are dead and others are wounded after a shooting at a Walmart store in US' Virginia, police said. Police believe there was one shooter, who is dead, a spokesman said. The spokesman further said that he did not have a number of dead, adding that it was "less than 10, right now".

346.title: Centre generating about 16 lakh jobs every month: Ashwini Vaishnaw
346.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday said about 16 lakh jobs are being generated every month by the Centre. He was addressing a ‘Rozgar Mela’ programme organised in Ajmer by the CRPF.
