"India has emerged as a source of energy with full of opportunities even in the situation of global economic crisis," he stated.

347.title: Why Rahul Gandhi now looks like Saddam Hussein?: Assam CM Himanta
347.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s looks have changed and he looks more like Saddam Hussein. "I said in a television interview...there's no problem with Rahul Gandhi's new look...at least make it like Vallabhbhai Patel," he added. "Even better if you look like Gandhiji but why do you look more like Saddam Hussein now?" Sarma asked.

348.title: Chai Point eyes IPO launch in the next 18-24 months: Report
348.article_body: Tea cafe chain Chai Point is looking to launch its IPO in the next 18-24 months, Moneycontrol reported. "Over the last one-and-a-half years, we have invested a lot in technology, building the brewing machines as we are driving for profitability...The goal is to list the company in about 18-24 months," Amuleek Singh Bijral, Co-founder and CEO of Chai Point said.

349.title: AFA should say it to my face if they don't want me to meet players: Aguero
349.article_body: Talking about the Argentina Football Association (AFA), former Argentina forward Sergio Aguero said, "I haven't seen the national team yet...Everything is kind of weird." "If the AFA doesn't want me to go, it's all good, but...[they should say it] to my face," added Aguero. "Maybe there are people who don't like being told bad things," he stated.

350.title: Congress demands case against BJYM for attack on its Pune office
350.article_body: The Congress party has demanded the police to file a case against BJP's youth wing Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) for the attack on its office in Pune last week. "When all party office-bearers were out of station to participate in the Bharat Jodo Yatra, the BJP youth workers tried to attack the Congress Bhavan," said Congress leader Arvind Shinde.

351.title: Dilip Kumar's sister Farida hospitalised in Mumbai: Report
351.article_body: Late actor Dilip Kumar's younger sister Farida is admitted at Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai since the last week, according to ETimes. Farida's nephews Saqib and Imran and Saira Banu are looking after her in the hospital, according to the report. Notably, Dilip Kumar passed away at the age of 98 in Mumbai last year.

352.title: Substantial amount of firm's assets stolen or missing: FTX lawyer
352.article_body: In FTX's bankruptcy hearing on Tuesday, FTX counsel James Bromley told a US court that "substantial amount of" the company's assets "have either been stolen or missing". Bromley added that the crypto exchange was "run as a personal fiefdom" of its ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. "It's one of the most abrupt and difficult company collapses in...history of corporate America," he stated.

353.title: 'Wasn’t Twitter supposed to die by now?' Musk amid criticism after his takeover
353.article_body: Amid criticism over his takeover of Twitter, Elon Musk on Wednesday tweeted, "Wasn’t Twitter supposed to die by now or something…?" Musk further remarked, "Maybe we’ve gone to heaven/hell and don’t know it." After Musk’s takeover, his changes including layoffs at the company and an $8 blue tick subscription, among others, have been receiving criticism.

354.title: Which words have been selected for Oxford 'Word of the Year 2022'?
354.article_body: Three words - 'goblin mode', '#IStandWith' and 'metaverse' have been selected by Oxford University Press for its 'Word of the Year 2022'. It has been announced that the Oxford word of the year is to be decided by the public for the first time. They were chosen by a team of lexicographers from Oxford University Press.

355.title: Punjab school bans grandparents' entry at function; served notice
355.article_body: Punjab School Education Department has served a show-cause notice to a school in Khanna after it banned the entry of grandparents at the school's annual day function, state minister Harjot Singh Bains said. "The school showed disrespect towards our elders, which won't be tolerated," he added. Green Grove Public School was told to reply to the notice within two days.

356.title: 3 domestic helps arrested in Hyd, 81 tolas of gold jewellery recovered
356.article_body: The Narayanaguda Police arrested three domestic workers and recovered 81 tolas of gold ornaments worth ₹36 lakh from them. The accused were working in the house of an event organiser for the last 10 years. While the complainant was shifting his residence, he discovered that a box containing gold ornaments was missing. The police caught the accused within 24 hours.

357.title: Allen Solly announces The Tuxedo Wedding Collection
357.article_body: Allen Solly has launched the Tuxedo Wedding fest with exclusive offers & services across 50+ varieties of party suits and blazers, across major cities. Wedding shopping becomes special when you pick a masterpiece that suits your vibe, it said. The premium fabric, eye-catching hues, rich craftsmanship and gorgeous fits of our collection will make one steal the show, it added.

358.title: PM Modi using child for poll campaign: Cong in complaint to NCPCR
358.article_body: Congress filed a complaint with child rights body NCPCR against PM Narendra Modi, accusing him of using a minor for Gujarat election campaign. BJP had shared a video showing a girl with PM Modi hailing the party's governance. "Have also marked a copy to the Election Commission for violation of the Model Code of Conduct," tweeted Congress leader Supriya Shrinate.

359.title: Nykaa stock falls over 2% a day after CFO announces resignation
359.article_body: A day after Nykaa's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Arvind Agarwal announced his resignation from his position effective November 25, the stock of its parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures was trading over 2% lower on Wednesday. At 10 am, its stock was trading 2.45% lower at ₹170.90 apiece on the BSE.

360.title: One of world's largest cargo plane lands at Mumbai Airport; pics surface
360.article_body: One of the world's largest cargo plane Airbus Beluga Super Transporter made a landing at Mumbai Airport on Tuesday afternoon. It is reportedly one of the heaviest arrivals in Mumbai in the last few years. "Lucky few passengers who witnessed this giant aircraft were left awestruck by the gorgeous sight," said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport's spokesperson.

361.title: Mumbai Police help 2 Kenyan women get back ₹15 lakh left behind in cab
361.article_body: The Mumbai Police traced a cab and recovered a bag containing ₹15 lakh, which two Kenyan women had forgotten inside the vehicle on Monday evening, police said. The women immediately approached the police and lodged a complaint. With the help of CCTV footage, police managed to get the car’s registration number and later located its driver in the Kalbadevi locality.

362.title: Gujarat BJP suspends 12 more rebels for contesting as independent candidates
362.article_body: BJP has suspended 12 more rebels for contesting as independent candidates after being denied tickets for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. Those suspended include Madhu Shrivastav, Dinu Patel, Dhavalsinh Zala, Kuldipsinh Raul, Khatubhai Pagi, SM Khant, JP Patel, Ramesh Zala, Amarshi Zala, Ramsinh Thakor, Mavji Desai and Lebji Thakor. On Sunday, BJP suspended seven others over the same issue.

363.title: Punjabi actress Nikeet posts video after story about her death posted on her Instagram
363.article_body: Punjabi actress Nikeet Dhillon posted a video after a story about her death was posted on her Instagram account. Nikeet said that her account was hacked, adding, "I did not know how to react to it. How did the person (hacker) even go and do this." "We have a family that gets affected," she said in the video.

364.title: New video shows Satyendar Jain getting 'proper food' in jail after viral massage video
364.article_body: A new CCTV footage from Tihar jail showed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain getting "proper food" in jail, reported ANI. The minister has gained 8 kg of weight while being in jail, contrary to his lawyer's claims of him having lost 28 kgs, said ANI citing Tihar Jail sources. Earlier, videos of the minister getting a massage inside jail went viral.

365.title: It hurts a lot: Argentina striker Lautaro after loss vs Saudi Arabia
365.article_body: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez said his team's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener "hurts a lot". "We lost...due to our mistakes...We have two finals left," added Lautaro. Reacting to his team's defeat, Argentine winger Angel Di Maria said, "We could [have] easily won 5-0...We knew Saudi Arabia were going to play like that."

366.title: 3 Pune policemen create ruckus at hotel, threaten manager; booked
366.article_body: Three policemen in Pune have been booked for allegedly creating a ruckus at Metro Hotel and threatening the manager. According to the manager, the three forced him to serve them liquor at around 1.15 am, after the place was closed and abused hotel staffers. Following the incident, a senior police officer visited the spot and a case was registered.

367.title: Man burns down property of lover's father after she refuses to elope in Maha
367.article_body: A man, having an extramarital affair, was arrested as he burned down a mini truck and a vegetable shop owned by his girlfriend’s father after she refused to move with him in Nagpur’s Waghoda village in Maharashtra, police said. They were in a relationship for the last seven months due to which his wife left him, police added.

368.title: Slept in 2-3 screenings of 'Taare Zameen Par', was young: Darsheel
368.article_body: 'Taare Zameen Par' actor Darsheel Safary shared that he attended seven screenings of the 2007 release, out of which, he "slept the last two-three times". "I was young...I remember sleeping in one premiere and when I woke up...everyone...was crying. It was gloomiest atmosphere possible," he recalled. He said, at the age of 25, he understood why the film was loved.

369.title: B2B startup Soptle raises $300,000 from Kube VC, Dunzo Co-founder
369.article_body: Soptle, B2B retail commerce startup, has secured $300,000 in an angel round led by early-stage venture capital firms Kube VC and Soonicorn LLP. Other angel investors including Dunzo Co-founder Ankur Agarwal, Fitso Co-founder Saurabh Aggarwal and Gati CEO Pirojshaw Sarkari also participated in the funding round. The startup, founded by Pravas Chandragiri, had raised an undisclosed amount in August.

370.title: Inox Green Energy Services to make its market debut today
370.article_body: Inox Green Energy Services, the wind power operation and maintenance service provider, is going to make its stock market debut on Wednesday. The company's initial public offering to raise ₹740 crore, which started on November 11 and concluded on November 15, was subscribed 1.6 times. The issue price of the IPO was ₹61-₹65 per share.

371.title: Musk cuts home internet, daycare allowance & other perks for Twitter staff: Report
371.article_body: Elon Musk has cut perks such as home internet and daycare allowance for Twitter employees, as per a report. The report, citing an internal memo, said perks being discontinued include team activities, all costs associated with "wellness," "productivity," and "new hire productivity". Musk said that "allowances will be reevaluated over time and may be added back when company's situation improves".

372.title: Truck driver accused in 48 car-pileup incident in Pune gets bail
372.article_body: A court has granted bail to the truck driver who is accused in the 48 car-pileup incident on Pune's Navale bridge on Tuesday. Meanwhile, a police officer said that the police are trying to piece together the sequence of events and technical aspects of the accident. The cleaner who was booked for aiding the truck driver was also granted bail.

373.title: Construction of Bengaluru airport Terminal 3 to start after 10 yrs: Fairfax
373.article_body: The construction of Terminal 3 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) has been delayed until BIAL's (Bangalore International Airport Limited's) fiscal year 2034, Fairfax India said. BIAL is responsible for operating the KIA airport and Fairfax India owns a 54 percent stake in the company. Fairfax said this while announcing its third quarter financial results.

374.title: We need players who can run: Burnley coach Kompany on signing Ronaldo
374.article_body: Talking about Burnley potentially signing Cristiano Ronaldo after his Manchester United exit, ex-Manchester City captain and Burnley manager Vincent Kompany said, "We need players who can run." Discussing Ronaldo's exit, Kompany added, "Everybody loses apart from...the Manchester United manager." Ronaldo had earlier stated that he turned down a €350-million offer from a team in Saudi Arabia.

375.title: Ground situation is alarming, need election commission chief who can't be bulldozed: SC
375.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that successive governments have destroyed the independence of the Election Commission of India by ensuring no Chief Election Commissioner gets the full six-year term. The court said, "Situation on the ground is fairly alarming". A Chief Election Commissioner should be someone "with character" who "does not allow himself to be bulldozed", the court added.

376.title: HP to lay off 4,000-6,000 employees globally over next 3 years
376.article_body: Computer maker HP has said that it plans to cut 4,000 to 6,000 employees globally over the next three years. In a statement, HP said its ‘Future Ready Transformation plan' should result in annualized gross run rate savings of $1.4 billion or more in the next three years, with around $1 billion in costs including restructuring.

377.title: 20-year-old man fights off leopard with stick in Thane
377.article_body: A 20-year-old man reportedly fought off a leopard using a stick near Vihigaon village of Thane district on Monday afternoon. More, who fought the animal for over 10 minutes, said, "I was holding a bunch of sticks…Then I caught hold of a bigger stick and managed to keep the big cat at bay." He suffered deep scratches on his back.

378.title: Manchester United's American owners consider selling club
378.article_body: Manchester United on Tuesday said it was starting a process to explore strategic alternatives, including a new investment or a potential sale, 17 years after the American Glazer family bought the club. The Glazer family is working with financial advisers on the process, which could lead to a partial sale of the club or investments including stadium and infrastructure redevelopment.

379.title: I prefer Hindi cinema: Pankaj on rejecting Telugu, Malayalam films
379.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi shared that he has rejected offers from Telugu and Malayalam filmmakers because he feels he wouldn't be able to do justice to those films. He added that while he "prefers" and feels comfortable in Hindi cinema, he's open to working in other languages, including Hollywood, if "someone can write a Hindi-speaking character" for him.

380.title: Cyberabad Police to auction 504 abandoned, unclaimed vehicles
380.article_body: The Cyberabad Police will auction 504 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types pooled at Moinabad police station grounds. The police have directed people who might have any objection or interest in relation to any of these vehicles to file an application before the police station SHO concerned and claim the vehicle within a period of six months.

381.title: Disney CEO Iger could be asked to identify his successor again: Report
381.article_body: Bob Iger, who has been named the CEO of The Walt Disney Company for the next two years, could be asked to pick his successor, Reuters reported. Part of his mandate, according to Disney, is to work with the board to develop a successor. Iger, 71, was the Disney CEO for 15 years previously and postponed his retirement four times.

382.title: Martin Guptill gives up his New Zealand central contract
382.article_body: Opener Martin Guptill has given up his New Zealand central contract. The New Zealand Cricket stated it agreed to release Guptill from his central contract so he can pursue playing opportunities elsewhere. Guptill was a part of New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, but didn't feature in any match. The 36-year-old is the third-highest T20I run-scorer with 3,531 runs.

383.title: Little concerned about bringing up my child in public eye: Alia
383.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she's "a little concerned" about bringing up her child in the public eye. She said it's something that she feels "very protective about". "I talk about it with my friends, with my family, and my husband (Ranbir Kapoor) a lot. I don't want there to be a, sort of, intrusion into my child's life," she added.

384.title: Vehicle rams into school van in Gr Noida; 7-year-old girl injured
384.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was injured after a vehicle rammed into a school bus in Greater Noida on Tuesday, police said. A police spokesperson said that the girl was taken to a hospital after her parents reached the spot and her condition is stable now. Six to seven children were on board the school van, the police spokesperson added.

385.title: 4-day-old baby girl found abandoned on footpath in Mumbai
385.article_body: A four-day-old baby girl was found abandoned on a footpath in Mumbai's Borivali West by police on Monday. The officers were on patrol duty when they heard a baby crying. The girl, wrapped in a thin blanket, was rushed to a hospital. "The baby girl was cold but did not have any injury marks on her body," said an officer.

386.title: Female tourist dances on sacred pyramid as locals throw bottles at her in Mexico
386.article_body: A female tourist in Mexico was attacked by locals for climbing a sacred pyramid. In a video shared on social media, the woman is seen dancing on the sacred site as locals threw bottles at her as part of their protest. She was later brought down by a security official present at the site.

387.title: Defending champions France defeat Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener
387.article_body: Defending champions France defeated Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener at Al Janoub Stadium in Al Wakrah. Olivier Giroud scored a brace in the match and equalled Thierry Henry's record for scoring most goals for France (51). Giroud, aged 36 years and 53 days, also became the oldest footballer to play for France in World Cup history.

388.title: Sam Bankman-Fried ran FTX as his 'personal fiefdom', court hears
388.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX was run as the "personal fiefdom" of 30-year-old ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, lawyers representing FTX told a US bankruptcy court on Tuesday. They said FTX spent $300 million on real estate in the Bahamas for the use of its executives. "FTX was in the control of...unsophisticated individuals. Some or all of them were compromised," a lawyer said.

389.title: My love for Manchester United will never change: Ronaldo after exit from club
389.article_body: Releasing a statement after Manchester United announced that he will be leaving the club with immediate effect, Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I love Manchester United and I love the fans, that will never ever change." He added, "However, it feels like the right time for me to seek a new challenge. I wish the team every success."

390.title: Criminal proceedings begin against Imran Khan in Toshakhana case
390.article_body: Criminal proceedings began against former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday in the Toshakhana gifts case. Khan is accused of "deliberately" concealing "his assets relating to Toshakhana gifts retained by him, particularly in years 2018 and 2019". The Toshakhana is a Pakistani government department that stores gifts given to lawmakers and senior officials by foreign governments.

391.title: UK businesses must reduce dependence on cheap labour: Keir Starmer
391.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer on Tuesday said businesses in Britain must reduce dependency on cheap, migrant labour. At a business leaders summit, he said more investments should be made to train workers "who are already here". He said firms must put forth a plan on how they intend to develop the skills of British workers.

392.title: Tribals in T'gana hack official to death for opposing felling of trees
392.article_body: A 47-year-old forest official was hacked to death by a group of tribals in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem when he tried to stop them from felling a tree plantation to take up 'podu cultivation'. The official, Chalamala Srinivas Rao, had gone to Bendalapadu area with a team of forest officials. "Tribals resisted and this led to a confrontation," police said.

393.title: Cristiano Ronaldo leaves Manchester United with immediate effect
393.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has left Manchester United by mutual agreement with immediate effect, the club announced. This comes after his interview wherein he criticised Manchester United and claimed he's being forced out of the club. "Everyone at Manchester United remains focused on continuing...team’s progress under Erik ten Hag and working together to deliver success on the pitch," the club said.

394.title: Musk asks if his tweets are considered 'work', Twitter users react
394.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "Wait, if I tweet, does that count as work?" Reacting to this, a Twitter user said, "I'm guessing your Tesla shareholders, who're losing their shirts as [Tesla's] stock continues to make multi-year lows...might not think that you tweeting counts as work." Another user tweeted, "You're promoting your business, so it is work."

395.title: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni dies at 67
395.article_body: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni died on Tuesday at the age of 67 after a spell of illness. Maroni was a longtime leader of the right-wing Northern League party. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Maroni had served Italy with "good sense and concreteness". Maroni served as the country's interior minister twice (1994-1995 and 2008-2011) and labour minister (2001) once.

396.title: Mexican Navy finds boat loaded with 10 tons of methamphetamines
396.article_body: The Mexican Navy on Tuesday said a patrol team found a shrimp boat loaded with approximately 10 tons of banned drug methamphetamines off its western Pacific coast. The boat was detected last week, said Navy Secretary Jose Rafael Ojeda. When the marine officials approached the vessel, its crew reportedly tried to sink the boat, he said.

397.title: Jadeja unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test, ODI series in Dec: Reports
397.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is reportedly unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test and ODI series in December. According to reports, Jadeja, who has been sidelined owing to an injury since this year's Asia Cup, is yet to fully recover. Notably, the Bangladesh tour, which consists of three ODIs and two Tests, will conclude by December 26.

398.title: Haven't seen son in 3 yrs: Mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect
398.article_body: The mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect Abdul Mateen Taha claimed that she hasn't seen her son in three years since he went missing from Bengaluru. She added that she hasn't seen him since he attained his engineering degree three years ago. His mother also said that if her son has done anything wrong, she wants him to be punished.

399.title: Maoists torch vehicles used for J'khand railway line construction
399.article_body: Maoists on Tuesday set ablaze around a dozen vehicles used for the construction of a railway line in Jharkhand's Latehar district, police said. In October, maoists had shot at three people in a village and asked railway line construction workers to refrain from work until levy was paid. A private construction firm is engaged in laying the 195-km-long railway line.

400.title: Centre approves ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in UP
400.article_body: The Centre approved ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in Uttar Pradesh under the Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana. According to a government spokesperson, the houses will be ready by March 2024. The spokesperson added that in the last five years, 27 lakh houses have been built under the scheme and 26 lakh were handed over to the beneficiaries.

401.title: 100 Indian pilgrims arrive in Pak for Hindu saint's birth anniversary
401.article_body: Around 100 Indian pilgrims arrived in Pakistan on Tuesday to attend the celebrations of the 314th birth anniversary of Hindu saint Satguru Shadaram Sahib in Sindh province. The pilgrims entered Pakistan via the Wagah border crossing, a Pakistani official said. The pilgrims will visit the historic Shadani Darbar temple, among other holy sites, he added.

402.title: Bank deposits of Kerala college seized for 'cheating parents'
402.article_body: The bank deposits of Dr SM CSI Medical College in Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala, worth ₹95.25 lakh have been attached under the anti-money laundering law, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Tuesday. The ED alleged the college authorities cheated parents by taking money from them and promising admission to their children. "However, admissions were not given," the ED said.
